name: Frisco Sour
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Squeeze in an orange wedge, garnish with a stemmed cherry, and serve.

name: Frozen Fruit Daiquiri
instructions: Add pieces of a chosen fruit, syrup (of that chosen fruit), rums, sugar, lime juice and crushed ice to a blender, and blend. Pour into a cocktail glass, and serve. Popular fruits to choose; bananas, pineapples and strawberries.

name: Gene Tunney
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Golden Colada
instructions: Shake over crushed ice in a shaker, and strain into a large highball glass over crushed ice. Garnish with a pineapple chunk and a stemmed cherry, and serve.

name: Golden Nail
instructions: Stir over ice cubes in a small highball glass, and serve.

name: Golden Rye Fizz
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except soda) well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with soda, add a cocktail cherry, and serve.

name: Goldie
instructions: Heat in a heat-resistant glass, add orange peel, and serve.

name: Good Morning Eggnog
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a large highball glass over ice cubes. Sprinkle with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Green Leaves

name: Green Russian #2
instructions: Stir over crushed ice in a small highball glass. Add a small amount of soda if desired, and serve.

name: Habana Libre
instructions: Squeeze a lime wedge in a collins glass, and drop into the glass. Add grenadine and rums, fill with crushed ice, and stir well.

name: Happy New Year
instructions: Shake brandy, port and orange juice well over ice cubes in a shaker. Strain into a champagne flute, fill with champagne, and serve.

name: Harvard
instructions: Stir in a mixing glass filled with ice cubes. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Havana Sidecar
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Havana Special
instructions: Shake over crushed ice in a shaker, strain into a large highball glass over crushed ice, and serve.

name: Hemingway
instructions: Pour pernod into a champagne flute, fill with champagne, and serve.

name: Hot Frenchman
instructions: Heat well in a heat-resistant glass or cup. Stir, add twists of lemon and orange peel, and serve.

name: Hot M.M.M.
instructions: Heat in a heat-resistant glass or cup. Add twists of orange and lemon peel, and serve.

name: Hot Marie
instructions: Heat liquors in a heat-resistant glass or cup, and fill with coffee. Add sugar, to taste, and serve.

name: International Bar Fly
instructions: Place a single ice cube into a champagne flute. Add liquors, fill with champagne, and serve.

name: I.B.U.
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except champagne) over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a champagne flute. Fill with champagne, and serve.

name: Iced Tea Cocktail
instructions: Pour over crushed ice in a large highball glass, stir well, and serve.

name: Income Tax Cocktail

instructions: Blend briefly with a glassful of crushed ice in a pina colada glass. Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a cherry, add straws, and serve.

name: Strawberry Colada
instructions: Blend briefly with a glassful of crushed ice in a pina colada glass. Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a cherry, add straws, and serve.

name: Tropicolada
instructions: Blend briefly with a glassful of crushed ice in a pina colada glass. Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a cherry, add straws, and serve.

name: Ritz Old-Fashioned
instructions: Rim an old-fashioned glass with lemon juice and caster sugar. Place a teaspoon-sized sugar cube into the glass, and saturate with angostura bitters. Fill the glass three-quarters of the way with broken ice, shake other ingredients (except soda) and strain into the glass. Top with a small amount of soda water if desired. Add two cherries on a stick, garnish with half slices of orange and lemon, and serve.

name: Remmsen Cooler
instructions: Pour into an ice-filled collins glass with a spiral of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Sporran Cooler
instructions: Pour into an ice-filled collins glass with a spiral of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Roman Punch
instructions: Combine and mix all ingredients except champagne and rum in a punch bowl with ample ice. Add orange slices and the grated zest of one orange. Add champagne and rum prior to serving.

name: Sauternes House Punch
instructions: Dissolve sugar in wine and combine all ingredients in a large jug with ample ice to cool. Add in-season fruit slices or pieces.

name: Scorpion Punch
instructions: Combine and mix ingredients in a large ice-filled jug. Add slices of orange and a sprig of mint, and serve.

name: Somerset Punch
instructions: Combine and mix ingredients in a punch bowl with a large block of ice. Add sliced strawberries, and serve in wine glasses.

name: Strawberry Punch
instructions: Combine and mix in a punch bowl with a large block of ice. Add slices strawberries, and serve into wine glasses.

name: Toledo Punch
instructions: Pour the soda, lemon juice, cognac, mint and fruits into a large punch bowl. Slowly dissolve in the sugar, to taste. Add the champagne, brandy, claret and wine, and top with 3 liters of water. Add a block of ice. Serve in wine glasses.

name: Trinidad Rum Punch
instructions: Boil water and dissolve the sugar. Add remaining ingredients. Serve hot and sprinkle with nutmeg.

name: Tropical Punch
instructions: Combine and mix in a punch bowl. Add fruits and sufficient ice to chill. Serve in wine glasses.

name: Winter Wine
instructions: Heat in a small saucepan and pour into heat-proof cups just before boiling. Add a slice of lemon to each cup, and serve.

name: Rosemary
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemonade) and strain into a highball glass three-quarters filled with crushed ice. Add lemonade, garnish with a slice of lime and a strawberry, add straws and serve.

name: Southern Ginger
instructions: Crush the mint gently in a highball glass. Fill with broken ice, add remaining ingredients and mix gently. Add straws, and serve.

name: Strawberry Kiss
instructions: Blend briefly with half a glassful of crushed ice in a wine goblet. Garnish with half a caster sugar-coated strawberry, and serve.

name: Strawberry Salad
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except soda water) and strain into a pina colada glass filled with broken ice. Add the soda, garnish with fruit, add straws and serve.

name: Strawberry Split
instructions: Blend all ingredients (except lemonade) briefly with half a glassful of crushed ice in a pina colada glass. Add lemonade, garnish with a strawberry, add straws and serve.

name: Summertime Soda
instructions: Dissolve sugar in juices in a highball glass three-quarters filled with ice. Add soda, top with ice cream, and garnish with fruit. Add straws, and serve.

name: Tenderberry
instructions: Blend briefly with three-quarters of a glassful of crushed ice. Add the ginger ale, garnish with a strawberry, and serve.

name: Ugly Virgin
instructions: Shake juices and strain into an ice-filled highball glass. Add lemonade, garnish with a slice of Ugli fruit, add straws and serve.

name: Virgin Bellini
instructions: Pour into a wine glass, and serve.

name: Virgin Colada
instructions: Shake and strain into a wine goblet filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a cherry, add a straw, and serve.

name: Virgin Raspberry Daiquiri
instructions: Blend briefly with half a glassful of crushed ice in a wine goblet. Garnish with raspberries, and serve.

name: Round-Up
instructions: Shake, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Royal Wild Strawberry
instructions: Pour into a champagne saucer, and serve.

name: Royale Coffee
instructions: Add coffee and cognac to an irish coffee cup and sweeten to taste. Gently float whipped cream on top, sprinkle with grated chocolate, and serve.

name: Russian Coffee
instructions: Add coffee, vodka and kahlua to irish coffee cup and sweeten to taste. Gently float cream on top, add amaretto, and garnish with a cherry.

name: Scandinavian Coffee
instructions: Add coffee and aquavit to an irish coffee cup and sweeten to taste. Gently float cream on top, sprinkle with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Shamrock Coffee
instructions: Pour irish mist and coffee into an irish coffee cup and sweeten to taste. Gently float cream on top, sprinkle wth chocolate, and serve.

name: Tropical Coffee
instructions: Pour gold rum and coffee into an irish coffee cup and sweeten to taste. Gently float cream on top, sprinkle wth cinnamon, and serve.

name: Rum Scaffa
instructions: Pour into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Tijuana Coffee
instructions: Add the a heat-proof goblet and sweeten to taste. Mix briskly, allowing foam to form and sprinkle with ground cinnamon.

name: Vruica Rakia
instructions: Heat in a small saucepan, dissolving sugar. Serve in a heat-proof cup when hot.

name: Santa Cruz Fix
instructions: Pour into an old-fashioned glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with in-season fruit, add short straws and a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Seville Chocolate
instructions: Combine mandarin napoleon and cocoa in a heat-proof irish coffee cup, and sweeten to taste. Gently float the cream on top, sprinkle with grated chocolate, and serve.

name: Seville Highball
instructions: Pour into an ice-filled highball glass. Add a twist of orange peel, and serve.

name: Sky Highball
instructions: Pour scotch whisky and pineapple juice into a highball glass three-quarters filled with ice. Sprinkle curacao on top, add a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Sherry Cobbler
instructions: Pour into a wine goblet filled with broken ice and mix. Garnish with in-season fruit, add straws, and serve.

name: Snuggler
instructions: Pour peppermint schnapps and cocoa into an irish coffee cup, and sweeten to taste. Gently float cream on top, sprinkle with grated chocolate, and serve.

name: Southern Mint Julep
instructions: Pour into a collins glass and fill with crushed ice. Mix gently and serve.

name: Summer Rain
instructions: Blend all ingredients (except lemonade) briefly with half a glassful of crushed ice and pour into a highball glass. Add lemonade, garnish with fruit, add straws and serve.

name: Supreme
instructions: Shake, strain into a champagne saucer filled with crushed ice, and serve.

name: Vodka Pina Colada
instructions: Add ingredients to a shaker and swirl until sugar is dissolved. Sweeten further if needed. Shake briefly with a glassful of crushed ice, and strain into a pina colada glass. Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a cherry, add straws, and serve.

name: Zulu
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cola) and strain into an ice-filled collins glass. Add cola, garnish with a slice of lime and a cherry, and serve.

name: Absinthe Drip
instructions: Add absinthe and one large cube of ice to an old-fashioned glass. Place an absinthe spoon across the top of the glass with the sugar on it, and pour drops of water onto the spoon. The water will drop through the holes in the absinthe spoon.

name: Absolutely Bananas
instructions: Shake well with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Alabazam
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except soda) with ice and strain into a highball glass with ice. Top with soda, stir, and serve.

name: Alize Cocktail
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry, and serve.

name: Amber Dream
instructions: Pour into an old-fashioned glass with ice and stir. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Anejo Highball
instructions: An original cocktail created by expert bartender Dale DeGroff in 2000.

name: Apricot-Mango Martini
instructions: Muddle the fresh mango in the bottom of a mixing glass and add all other ingredients. Shake well with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Bahia Breeze
instructions: Build, in order, in a highball glass over ice. Garnish with a wedge of lime, and serve.

name: Bakunin
instructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker, and shake well. Pour into a small highball glass over crushed ice, and serve.

name: Balm Cocktail
instructions: Mix all ingredients with the orange slices and shake well with ice. Strain into a chilled martini glass, garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Frozen Barcelona
instructions: Combine ingredients in a blender with three-quarters of a cup of crushed ice. Pour into a london dock or sherry glass, garnish with a light dusting of cinnamon, and serve.

name: Batidas Frozen
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a lime wheel, and serve.

name: Blackberry Julep
instructions: Shake blackberry liqueur, lemon juice and simple syrup with ice, and strain into a highball glass filled with crushed ice. Stir until the glass begins to frost. Garnish with the berry marinade, and serve.

name: Black Rose
instructions: Pour grenadine, bitters and whiskey into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with ice. Stir, garnish with flamed lemon peel, and serve.

name: Blood Orange Cosmo
instructions: Shake well with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a slice of orange, and serve.

name: Blue Monday
instructions: Shake well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel on the glass, and serve.

name: Blue Train
instructions: Shake well with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Bull Shot
instructions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and shake well. Strain into a pint glass over ice, garnish with a twist of orange peel, and serve.

name: Bloody Butrum
instructions: Roll all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into a pint glass over ice, and serve.

name: Boulevard
instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Bourbon Stone Sour
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Garnish with a slice of orange and a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Bramble
instructions: Shake the gin, lime juice and syrup well with ice, and strain into a highball glass filled with crushed ice. Dribble the creme de mure down through the ice, and garnish with a lime wheel and raspberries.

name: Brandy Plush
instructions: Shake well with ice and strain into a chilled wine glass. Dust with freshly grated nutmeg, and serve.

name: Brassy Blond
instructions: Shake well, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Breakfast Martini
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a piece of a slice of toast.

name: Bud Herrmann Brandy
instructions: Build in a highball glass, and serve.

name: Cape Cod
instructions: Combine in a highball glass with ice. Garnish with a wedge of lime, and serve.

name: Caribbean Bulldog
instructions: Build the kahlua, caribbean cream and milk (or half-and-half) over ice in a tall highball glass. Add coca-cola and stir gently. Add straws, and serve.

name: Caribe Cosmopolitan
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Caricature Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients over ice and strain into a large chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Chai Toddy
instructions: Stir all ingredients in a mug and serve steaming hot. Garnish with a peppermint stick.

name: Champagne Passion
instructions: Pour passion fruit puree into a champagne saucer and stir in the simple syrup (to taste). Slowly add the champagne whilst stirring gently. Float the alize on top, and serve.

name: Champagne Tropicale
instructions: Pour the mango puree into a mixing glass, then slowly add the champagne whilst stirring gently. Float the maraschino on top, and serve.

name: Cherry Crush
instructions: Muddle four of the cherries with the lemon juice and maraschino in a mixing glass. Add gin, shake well with ice, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with remaining cherry, and serve.

name: Cherry Kiss
instructions: Shake all ingredients well and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass. Dust with grated nutmeg, and serve.

name: Chocolate Punch
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Dust with grated nutmeg, and serve.

name: Citrus Cream
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a goblet or london dock glass. Serve.

name: Claremont
instructions: Muddle an orange slice and a cherry with bitters and curacao in the bottom of an old-fashioned glass. Remove the orange rind, and add bourbon, ice, and soda. Garnish with the remaining orange slice and cherry, and serve.

name: Claret Lemonade
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a wine goblet over ice. Garnish with a lemon wheel, and serve.

name: Club Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a martini or cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel and a strawberry, and serve.

name: Coco Berry
instructions: Muddle the raspberries and chambord in a mixing glass. Add ice, rum, and creme de cacao. Stir to chill, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Coffee Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a small wine or port glass. Dust with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Cognac and Soda
instructions: Pour cognac over ice in a highball glass, fill with club soda, and serve.

name: Coctel Algeria
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Colony Room Cocktail
instructions: Place a dash of ricard into a cocktail glass and swill to coat the inside. Pour out the excess. Chill the gin, vermouth and bitters by stirring with ice, and strain into the prepared glass. Serve.

name: Cosmalize
instructions: Shake with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Crawdaddy
instructions: Pour vodka and lemonade into a highball glass. Top with the soda, garnish with a slice of lemon, and serve.

name: Champagne Cobbler
instructions: Muddle the fruit and maraschino in the bottom of a bar glass. Add ice and champagne, stir gently and strain into a champagne flute. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Japanese Cobbler
instructions: Muddle a skinless pineapple wedge, one piece of orange and one piece of lemon with maraschino liqueur in the bottom of a bar glass. Add the sake and shake with ice. Strain into a double old-fashioned glass filled with crushed ice and top with a splash of soda. Garnish with a sprig of mint, the remaining fruit wedges, and serve.

name: Whiskey Cobbler
instructions: Muddle a skinless pineapple wedge, one slice of orange and one wedge of lemon with orange curacao and water in the bottom of a bar glass. Add whiskey and ice, and shake well. Strain into a double old-fashioned glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with remaining fruit, and serve.

name: Cosmopolitan Delight
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and serve over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Top with a splash of red wine. Garnish with fresh fruit, and serve.

name: Strawberry Cosmopolitan
instructions: Muddle the cointreau and lime juice with all but one half of the strawberries in the bottom of a mixing glass. Add vodka and ice, shake well, and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with the reserved strawberry half, and serve.

name: Debonaire Cocktail
instructions: Stir ingredients together to chill, strain into a chilled martini glass, and serve.

name: Desert Healer
instructions: Build ingredients (except ginger ale) in a highball glass over ice, and fill with ginger ale. Garnish with orange peel and a cherry, and serve.

name: Deshler Cocktail
instructions: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with orange peel, and serve.

name: Di Saronno Punch
instructions: Shake amaretto, curacao, juices and bitters with ice and strain into a collins glass. Top with a splash of club soda. Garnish with a slice of orange and a cherry, and serve.

name: D.O.M. Cocktail
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: The Dorothy
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Douglas Fairbanks
instructions: Shake ingredients extremely well, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Dubliner
instructions: Pour liquor into a mixing glass with ice and stir to chill. Strain into a goblet, top with cream, and serve.

name: Dusty Rose
instructions: Shake ingredients, pour into a small cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Embassy Cocktail
instructions: Shake well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wedge, and serve.

name: Espresso Cocktail
instructions: Prepare a martini glass with a brown-sugared rim. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into the prepared glass, and serve.

name: Fancy Nancy
instructions: Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Fancy Tequila Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Faux Nog
instructions: Shake ingredients well with ice, and strain over crushed ice in a goblet. Dust with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Fernet Branca Cocktail
instructions: Stir with ice to chill and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Fitzgerald
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a lemon wedge, and serve.

name: Flirtini
instructions: Muddle the pineapple pieces and cointreau in the bottom of a mixing glass. Add vodka and pineapple juice and stir. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and top with champagne. Garnish with a cherry, and serve.

name: Whiskey Fizz
instructions: Shake whiskey, juice and syrup and strain into a highball glass filled with ice. Fill with lemon-lime soda, and serve.

name: Floradora
instructions: Build the gin, lime juice and raspberry liqueur in a highball glass filled with ice. Top with ginger ale, garnish with a wedge of lime and an edible flower, and serve.

name: French Flamingo
instructions: Shake ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lime peel, and serve.

name: French 95
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except champagne) with ice and strain into an ice-filled goblet. Top with champagne, and serve.

name: Gin Gin Highball
instructions: Build ingredients in a highball glass over ice. Stir, garnish with a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Gin Gin Mule
instructions: Muddle the lime juice, syrup and mint sprigs at the bottom of a mixing glass. Add gin and ginger beer and shake well. Pour over ice in a highball glass, top with soda and garnish with a wedge of lime.

name: Golden Girl
instructions: SHake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with grated orange zest, and serve.

name: Happy Honey Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a small martini glass.

name: Hawaiian Stone Sour
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a cherry and pineapple slice, and serve.

name: Hi Ho Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Honolulu Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a sugar-rimmed cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Ice House Highball
instructions: Build the vodka and lemonade in a large pint glass filled with ice, and top with a dash of creme de menthe. Garnish with an edible orchid flower.

name: International Stinger
instructions: Shake well with ice and pour over ice cubes (on the rocks) in an old-fashioned glass.

name: Irish Coffee #4
instructions: Combine the whiskey, coffee and syrup in an irish coffee cup. Gently ladle the cream on top, and serve.

name: Island Breeze
instructions: Build over ice in a highball glass. Garnish with a wedge of lime, and serve.

name: Island Rose
instructions: Shake well with ice and serve straight up or over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Float a rose petal on the surface, and serve.

name: Jacana
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Peach Brandy Julep
instructions: Strip the leaves from one sprig of mint and muddle them together with the peach liqueur and wedges. Add cognac (or bourbon) and shake. Strain into a highball glass filled with crushed ice and stir until the outside of the glass frosts. Add more crushed ice, if needed. Garnish with a second mint sprig, and serve.

name: Pineapple Julep
instructions: Muddle the leaves from two sprigs of mint, with the pineapple wedges and simply syrup, in a mixing glass. Add bourbon and ice, and shake well. Strain into a highball glass filled with crushed ice, and stir well until frosted. Garnish with two further mint sprigs, and serve.

name: Rainbow Julep
instructions: Muddle one of the mint sprigs with apricot brandy in the bottom of a mixing glass. Add bourbon and strain into a highball glass filled with crushed ice. Swirl with a barspoon until the outer glass frosts. Garnish with a mint sprig, and serve.

name: Jump Shot
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice, and strain into four seperate one-ounce shot glasses.

name: King Alfonse
instructions: Serve pousse cafe in a cordial glass.

name: Knickerbein Cocktail
instructions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake extremely well. Serve in a frosted glass and dust with freshly grated nutmeg and orange zest.

name: Latin Love
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender until smooth consistency. Rim a hurricane glass with grenadine and coconut shavings, and pour in the mixture. Serve.

name: Lemon Daisy
instructions: Stir the lemon juice, grenadine and simple syrup together in a white wine glass. Add ice, top with equal parts 7-up and soda water, and serve.

name: Lemon Meringue
instructions: Shake well with ice, strain into a chilled martini glass, and serve.

name: Le Perroquet
instructions: Pour campari, gin and orange juice into a champagne flute. Top with champagne, garnish with a twist of lemon and orange peel, and serve.

name: Electric Iced Tea
instructions: Build over ice in a highball glass. Squeeze in lemon wedges, stir, and serve.

name: London Iced Tea
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cola) with ice and strain into a collins glass three-quarters filled with ice. Top with coca-cola and stir. Garnish a wedge of lemon, and serve.

name: Miami Iced Tea
instructions: Build over ice in a highball glass. Fill with 7-up, garnish with a lemon wedge, and serve.

name: Leo Special
instructions: Shake well with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Lizzy Sour
instructions: Shake well with ice and strain into a martini or cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon wheel, and serve.

name: Lucky Double
instructions: Slice the lemon half further into four quarters, and drop into to a mixing glass. Add triple sec and muddle well. Add absolut mandrin and ice, shake well, and pour out into an old-fashioned glass. Serve.

name: Lust for Life
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Dust with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Macarena Mist
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over crushed ice, and serve.

name: Madison Avenue Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Garnish with a mint sprig and a slice of lime, and serve.

name: Mandrin Cherry Smash
instructions: Cut the lemon half into four quarters. Muddle with the cherry brandy in the bottom of a mixing glass. Add vodka and ice, and shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Mark Twain Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Marlene Dietrich
instructions: Shake ingredients well with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Squeeze in a piece of lemon and orange, and serve.

name: Eastern Manhattan
instructions: Stir with ice to chill and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry, and serve.

name: Red Manhattan
instructions: Stir with ice to chill and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry, and serve.

name: Maragato
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Black Banana
instructions: Mix ingredients together in a blender and pour into a martini glass. Float a small amount of whipped cream over the back of the spoon into the middle of the drink, garnish with a mint leaf, and serve.

name: Black Tequila
instructions: Shake ingredients and pour into a champagne tulip. Top with dry sparkling wine, and serve.

name: Excalibur
instructions: Mix ingredients in a blender and pour into a cocktail glass. Garnish with redcurrants, chocolate flakes and a mint leaf.

name: Sweet Temptation
instructions: Mix ingredients together in a shaker or blender and pour into a cocktail glass. Gently beat some cream and pour on top.

name: Black Mozart Sparkler
instructions: Shake ingredients in a shaker and pour into a champagne tulip. Top with dry red sparkling wine. Garnish with a red cherry on a cocktail stick, and serve.

name: Mozart Kaffee
instructions: Pour mozart and coffee into an irish coffee cup, and stir. Top with cream, and serve.

name: Mozart Esprit
instructions: Pour sprite over three or four ice cubes in a highball glass. Add black mozart chocolate liqueur and garnish with a slice of lemon. Add a straw, and serve.

name: Black Menta
instructions: Pour ingredients into a chilled shot glass, stir, and serve.

name: Black Lemon
instructions: Pour ingredients over two or three ice cubes in a chilled cocktail glass. Stir, and serve.

name: Bloody Margarita
instructions: Shake with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cadillac Margarita
instructions: Shake 100% blue agava tequila with grand marnier and lime juice, and strain into a chilled salt-rimmed cocktail glass. Serve.

name: Frozen Passion Margarita
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a blender and blend. Strain into a margarita glass rimmed with coarse salt, garnish with a wheel of lime, and serve.

name: Passion Margarita
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with coarse salt. Garnish with a lime wheel, and serve.

name: Tangerine Margarita
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass with a salted rim. Serve.

name: Nick and Nora Martini
instructions: Pour gin and vermouth into a mixing glass filled with ice, and stir well. Strain into a chilled martini glass, garnish with an olive, and serve.

name: Knickerbocker Martini
instructions: Pour into a mixing glass filled with ice, and stir well. Strain into a chilled martini glass, add a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Vodkatini
instructions: Stir the vodka with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with a pitted cocktail olive, and serve in front with an open bottle of vermouth situated in front of a fan across the room.

name: Sour Apple Martini
instructions: Assemble all ingredients in a cocktail shaker and shake well with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with a slice of apple, and serve.

name: Melon Martini
instructions: Muddle the melon, honey syrup, maraschino liqueur and lime juice together in a large mixing glass. Add vodka and ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with a sprig of mint, and serve.

name: Pineau Martini
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Pomegranate Martini
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Add a dash of rose water if available. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve. Our fan Murray W. on Facebook recommends trying the recipe with Grand Mariner [or Cointreau] instead of simple syrup.

name: Rosy Martini
instructions: Stir ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Smoky Martini
instructions: Stir both ingredients together with ice to chill. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Soho Martini
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Upside-Down Martini
instructions: Stir together in a mixing glass filled with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Watermelon Martini
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint, and serve.

name: Yin Martini
instructions: Stir to chill in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with oriental fruit or litchi nut.

name: Yang Martini
instructions: Pour into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with olives, and serve.

name: Meloncholy Baby
instructions: Blend all ingredients with crushed ice and pour into a collins glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Melon Daiquiri
instructions: Blend ingredients with a handful of ice in a mixing glass. Pour into a large goblet, garnish with melon balls, and serve.

name: Melon Lime Daiquiri
instructions: Muddle the melon, sugar syrup, maraschino liqueur and lime juice together in a container. Add rum and ice, shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with fresh sprigs of mint, and serve.

name: Mexican Blonde
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Mud and Blood
instructions: Shake with ice, strain into a large highball glass, and serve.

name: Negrita
instructions: Combine ingredients in a shot glass, and serve.

name: New Orleans Cocktail
instructions: Stir ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Old Flame
instructions: Shake ingredients well to chill and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Op Smash
instructions: Slice the lemon pieces in half and place into the bottom of a mixing glass. Add syrup and maraschino, and muddle well. Add an old-fashioned glass of ice to the mixing glass, then pour in the vodka. Shake well for 10 seconds, and pour everything out into the old-fashioned glass. Add additional cracked ice where needed, and serve.

name: Orange Breeze
instructions: Build in a large goblet with ice and stir. Garnish with a slice of orange, and serve.

name: Paris Cocktail
instructions: Shake ingredients well with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed lemon peel, and serve.

name: Parisian Blond Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Add a drop or two of vanilla extract on top of the cream, and serve.

name: Picon Punch
instructions: Shake the amer picon, lemon juice and grenadine well with ice and strain into a highball glass filled with ice. Top with soda, garnish with fruit, and serve.

name: Pilgrim Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients and strain into a cocktail glass. Serve hot, or cold.

name: Pink Coral
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and pour into a large goblet. Garnish with tropical fruit slices/pieces if available, and serve.

name: Rainbow Sour
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and pour into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a cherry and an orange slice, and serve.

name: Red Beer
instructions: Add tomato juice to a regular pint of lager, and serve.

name: Ricard Tomate
instructions: Pour ricard and grenadine into a highball glass. Add water and ice, and serve.

name: City Rickey
instructions: Pour gin, lime juice and cointreau into a highball glass three-quarters filled with ice. Fill with equal parts of cranberry juice and soda, and stir. Garnish with a slice of orange and lime, and serve.

name: Stone Rickey
instructions: Pour gin, lime juice, orange juice and simple syrup into a highball glass three-quarters filled with ice. Fill with club soda and stir. Garnish with a slice of orange, and serve.

name: Lime Rickey
instructions: Build all ingredients in a collins glass and top with soda. Garnish with a spiral of lime peel, and serve.

name: Rosarita
instructions: Layer each ingredient, in turn, over the back of a spoon, in an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with ice. Serve.

name: Rosarita Highball
instructions: Shake the tequila, cassis and lime juice and strain into an ice-filled highball glass. Fill with ginger ale, garnish with a slice of cucumber, and serve.

name: Rosetta
instructions: Shake well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Royal Hawaiian
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a small cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Royal Romance
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Rye Club Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and pour over shaved ice in an old-fashioned glass.

name: Salt-and-Pepper Highball
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a rimmed, ice-filled highball glass.

name: San Salvador
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into an ice-filled double old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a slice of orange and lime, and serve.

name: Scorpino
instructions: Blend all ingredients in a blender, pour into a highball glass, and serve.

name: Sea Breeze
instructions: Pour vodka into an iced highball glass. Fill partially with grapefruit juice and top with cranberry juice. Garnish with a lime wedge, and serve.

name: Sherry Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Sloe Gin Fizz
instructions: Shake the gin, lemon juice and simple syrup with ice and strain into an ice-filled highball glass. Top with soda, garnish with a slice of orange and a cherry, and serve.

name: Smith and Kearns
instructions: Build in an iced highball glass. Top with soda, and serve.

name: South Beach
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: South Coast Cocktail
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in a mixing glass with ice. Stir gently and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Southside
instructions: Muddle one sprig of mint with the lime pieces, lime juice, and simple syrup in the bottom of a bar glass. Add gin and shake well. Pour into a goblet over crushed ice and stir until the outer-glass frosts. Top with soda water, garnish with remaining sprig of mint, and serve.

name: Sparkling Hunt Punch
instructions: Chill all ingredients (except champagne) and strain into a champagne flute. Top with champagne, and serve.

name: Steeplechase
instructions: Muddle the mint leaves with the curacao and brandy in the bottom of a mixing glass. Add all other ingredients, shake well and strain into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint, and serve.

name: Stork Club Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Suffering Bastard
instructions: Shake all ingredients well and strain into an ice-filled double old-fashioned glass. Garnish with slices of orange and lime, and serve.

name: Sundowner
instructions: Shake all ingredients and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Sunflower Highball
instructions: Build over ice in a highball glass. Dust with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Sunset Breeze
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of orange peel, and serve.

name: Suntory Cocktail
instructions: Shake, strain into an iced cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Apple Toddy
instructions: Place the baked apple, sugar and applejack into a glass or mug. Fill the glass two-thirds full with boiling water, and grate a little nutmeg on top.

name: Trinidad
instructions: Build in a highball glass over ice, garnish with a wedge of lime, and serve.

name: Tropical Highball
instructions: Build over ice in a highball glass. Garnish with a lime wedge, and serve.

name: Tropical Whiskey Punch
instructions: Muddle all ingredients except the whiskey in a bar glass. Add whiskey, shake with ice, and strain into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a pineapple and lemon wedge, a cherry, and serve.

name: Twentieth Century
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve.

name: 209 East Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Valencia #2
instructions: Shake the apricot brandy, orange juice and bitters with ice and strain into a chilled champagne flute. Top with champagne, garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Vendome
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Whiskey Daisy
instructions: Slice the lemon quarter in half, and muddle with the lime, syrup and chartreuse in a mixing glass. Add whiskey, shake well with ice, and strain into a highball glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a lemon and lime wedge, a cherry, and serve.

name: Whiskey Peach Smash
instructions: Muddle all ingredients except whiskey in a bar glass. Add whiskey, and shake with ice. Strain into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass, garnish with a sprig of mint and a peach slice, and serve.

name: White Bat
instructions: Build all ingredients in a tall glass over ice. Stir, add a straw, and serve.

name: Wonder Bra
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve.

name: Pousse Mozart
instructions: Pour the white mozart into a cordial glass. Slowly and carefully pour original mozart on top using the back of the spoon. Serve.

name: Mozart Sonatine
instructions: Pour the chocolate liqueur over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Add grand marnier, garnish with a slice of orange, and serve.

name: Mozart Orange
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a mixing glass. Pour over ice cubes in a highball glass, add a straw, and serve.

name: Mozart Mint
instructions: Serve on the rocks in a tall glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint.

name: Mozart Milkshake
instructions: Shake or blend ingredients and pour into a tall glass. Sprinkle with grated chocolate, add a straw, and serve.

name: Mozart Cola
instructions: Pour liquids into a hurricane glass, and add a scoop of ice cream on top. Sprinkle with chocolate shavings, add straws, and serve.

name: Don Giovanni
instructions: Pour liquids into a champagne saucer. Add a dollop of whipped cream to the center, sprinkle with chocolate shavings, and serve.

name: Papagena
instructions: Mix well in a shaker with three or four ice cubes. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Painkiller
instructions: Mix well in a shaker with three or four ice cubes. Strain into an old-fashioned glass, garnish with a pineapple piece, and serve.

name: Schoko Royal
instructions: Mix well in a shaker with three or four ice cubes. Pour into a cocktail glass, sprinkle with chocolate shavings, and serve.

name: Magic Flute
instructions: Shake ingredients well in a shaker. Strain into a cocktail glass glass over three or four ice cubes, and serve.

name: Butterfly
instructions: Shake well in a shaker with two ice cubes. Strain into a cocktail glass, add a short straw, and serve.

name: Amade
instructions: Shake with three or four ice cubes in a cocktail shaker, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: French Summer
instructions: Pour chambord into a wine glass filled with ice. Add sparkling water, squeeze in a slice of lemon and orange, and stir.

name: Chambord Daiquiri
instructions: Blend with one cup of crushed ice in a shaker or blender for 30 seconds. Strain into a champagne saucer, and serve.

name: Mistral
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Pour into a champagne saucer, and serve.

name: Bacardi Hurricane
instructions: Shake and strain into a hurricane glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a slice of lime, and serve.

name: Mont Blanc
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender for 20 seconds. Pour into a wine glass, and serve.

name: Pisco Sour #2
instructions: Shake ingredients vigorously with ice. Strain into a champagne flute, and add the bitters as an aromatic garnish.

name: Holland Martini
instructions: Pour gin and vermouth into a cocktail glass. Squeeze a twist of lemon peel over the glass, drop into glass, and serve.

name: Cherry Cheese Cake
instructions: Combine Stoli vodka and grenadine in a shaker with ice. Add a splash of pineapple juice. Shake, strain into a shot glass, and serve.

name: The Incredible Hulk
instructions: Combine the Hpnotiq with the cognac in a highball glass over ice. Admire the transformation, and enjoy. Chill both ingredients beforehand for best results.

name: Incredible Hulk
instructions: Stir together the Hennessy cognac and the Hypnotic tropical-fruit liqueur to make a green incredible hulk color. Serve.

name: Snakebite #4
instructions: One of the more popular snakebite drinks, with whiskey and lime juice.

name: Cement Mixer #2
instructions: The Cement Mixer drinks are renowned for their ability to curdle when mixed together (mostly in your mouth). The contributor suggests you give it to a friend for a prank!
The 136 can be served as a shot or as a refreshing drink in a chilled cup.

name: 18 Till You Die
instructions: Shake ingredients on ice until cold. Strain into a shot glass, and serve.

name: 20/20 Lemon
instructions: Pour MD 20/20 (try any flavor) into a cup. Add Bacardi limon rum, and serve.

name: 414SS Daiquiri
instructions: A typically strong 151-rum mix. The 414SS Daiquiri works best after a few reqular Daiquiris.

name: 7-Nut
instructions: Pour coconut rum and 7-up into a highball glass. Add ice to suit, and serve.

name: A Splash of Mexico
instructions: Pour the corona lager into a highball glass. Fill with V8 Splash, or vary amount to taste, and serve.

name: A Very Berry Surprise
instructions: Thoroughly mix all ingredients in a blender to make a smoothie. Serve in a classic margarita glass. Garnish with either cherry, raspberries, strawberries, or all!

name: Abelito
instructions: Combine equal parts of vodka and club soda in a highball glass. Add a splash of lime juice and cranberry juice, and serve.

name: After Dinner Mint #2
instructions: Combine the peppermint schnapps, creme de menthe, and gin together in a highball glass. Add a splash of Listerine, stir, and serve.

name: Aid Paradise
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a highball glass with several ice cubes, and serve.

name: Airhead
instructions: Pour vodka into the bottom of a mixing glass. Add hawaiian punch, squeeze in a wedge of lime, add sprite, ice, and shake. Pour into a hurricane glass, and serve.

name: Almond Joy #2
instructions: Mix ingredients together in a mixing glass. Pour into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: American Death
instructions: American Death is a fiery combination of two cinnamon-schnapps liqueurs and one peppermint schnapps.

name: Amnesia
instructions: Combine both the watermelon and grape-flavored schnapps, Bacardi limon, orange juice and pineapple juice in an old-fashioned glass. Serve.

name: Anabolic Steroid
instructions: Pour blue curacao into a shot glass, followed by midori then vodka. Serve.

name: Anti Freeze #5
instructions: Shake vodka and Midori with ice and strain, or pour on the rocks into a large or double-shot glass. Serve.

name: Apple Pie Shot #3
instructions: This Apple Pie Shot uses the same method of consumption as a Tequila Shot or Tequila Slammer. Very catching, and (as the contributor suggests) is loved by all at Trinity University in San Antonio.

name: Applebottom Pimp
instructions: Pour the Smirnoff green apple twist into a cocktail glass, and add the Pimp juice energy drink.

name: Are You Tough Enough?
instructions: Using only 100 proof liquors, ensure all schnapps are ice cold. Combine and mix all five liquors in a cocktail glass and drink like a shot.

name: Arnold Palmer
instructions: A most basic but effective combination, Arnold Palmer is a known drink at outdoor events. It is quite popular at the golf courses.

name: Asian Fetish
instructions: Asian Fetish is a popular drink at the Onyx Room in San Diego, Ca. A bartender named Eric created the drink while servicing at Shogun Kobe Restaurant.

name: B.O.N.U.S.
instructions: B.O.N.U.S. is a simple combination popular among post concert party attendees, usually in Wisconsin, Iowa, Oklahoma and Missourri.

name: Bacardi Rootbeer Float
instructions: Combine and mix together the rum and root beer in a beer mug. Add ice if desired, and serve.

name: Banana Slices in Beer
instructions: As we mention in the equally strange unsliced recipe, Banana in Beer, this combination seems to be creating an attraction in modern society.

name: Battery Acid
instructions: Battery Acid is another of those quick-fixes to getting drunk. Give it to someone you really hate.

name: Bazooka #2
instructions: Popular in Grand Rapids, MI area. This particular Bazooka recipe was invented by Brian Hobbs.

name: Bazooka Joe #2
instructions: Pour the Bacardi limon into a collins glass. Add a small, 8 oz can or thereabouts of Red Bull. Stir well, and serve.

name: Beach Haus
instructions: Pour Black Haus blackberry schnapps and Captain Morgan rum into a wine globlet with ice. Top with pineapple juice, garnish with a pineapple spear and a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Beauty and the Beast
instructions: Beauty and the Beast (the drink, not the story) originated at the Coral Reef in Parma, Ohio. For those who are paying attention, the tequila rose is the beauty and the jagermeister is the beast.

name: Beer Buster
instructions: Pour Smirnoff vodka into a highball glass, and fill with beer or ale. Add dashes of Tabasco sauce, stir lightly, and serve.

name: Berry Bananza
instructions: Combine ingredients in a collins glass. Stir, and serve.

name: Berry Chocolate Martini
instructions: Pour Black Haus into a cocktail shaker with ice. Add Smirnoff raspberry twist vodka and white creme de cacao. Shake, and strain into a cocktail/martini glass. Garnish with white chocolate shavings, and serve.

name: Bin Laden
instructions: According to the contributor, Bin Laden can be found in Wollongong, Australia.

name: Bird Feeder
instructions: Combine half a shot of each in a shot glass, and serve.

name: Bitches from Hell
instructions: Layer ingredients into a shot glass in order; jagermeister at the bottom, then banana liqueur, followed up with half-and-half.

name: Black and Blue #3
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into a double-shot glass, and serve.

name: Black Death #2
instructions: Pour ingredients into a shot glass as above, and serve.

name: Black Haus Basket
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a large or double-shot glass, and serve.

name: Black Haus Chimney
instructions: Pour the Black Haus blackberry schnapps and Captain Morgan spiced rum into a mug. Top with hot chocolate and fresh whipped cream.

name: Black Haus Icicle
instructions: Pour the Black Haus blackberry schnapps into a shot glass. Add Smirnoff vodka, followed by Cointreau, and serve.

name: Black Haus Mitten
instructions: Combine Black Haus blackberry schnapps and GoldSchlager in a glass mug. Stir, top with hot coffee and whipped cream, and serve.

name: Black Haus Orange Coffee
instructions: Combine Black Haus blackberry schnapps and Smirnoff orange twist vodka in a glass mug. Top with hot coffee and whipped cream, and serve.

name: Black Haus Twist
instructions: Pour Black Haus blackberry schnapps and Smirnoff citrus twist vodka into an old-fashioned glass with ice. Add cranberry juice, stir, and serve.

name: Black Ice
instructions: Black Ice is a popular beverage on the Michigan Tech campus. It was shared by a Mr Caesar Peterson.

name: Blackberry Martini
instructions: Add Black Haus blackberry schnapps and Smirnoff raspberry twist vodka to a cocktail shaker, with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail/martini glass. Garnish with a blackberry, and serve.

name: Blackdriver Haus
instructions: Pre-chill the Black Haus blackberry schnapps. Pour into a highball glass over ice, and add orange juice. Garnish with an orange wheel, and serve.

name: Blackhawk
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass. Add a perfectly ripe whole blackberry and a half-slice of lime, and serve.

name: Blast Furnace
instructions: Combine ingredients together in a whiskey sour glass, stir, and serve.

name: Bleeding Bacardi
instructions: Bleeding Bacardi, not surprisingly, was named after the anonymous contributor, a member of a local band named Redrum, who left a full shot of Bacardi on the bar while distracted and returned later to find what looked like blood in the Bacardi.

name: Blood of the Innocent
instructions: Pour hawaiian punch into a 12 oz highball glass. Take a gulp/mouthful, and fill the rest of the glass with vodka. Alter the proportions if you prefer a stronger bite.

name: Blue Bayou
instructions: Pour curacao and vodka over ice in a highball glass. Add lemonade, stir, and serve.

name: Blue Crayons
instructions: Pour blueberry flavored vodka into a highball glass over ice. Add a small can of chilled cranberry juice, and serve.

name: Blue Grapes
instructions: Combine Absolut, Kool-Aid and Sprite in a shaker, and shake well. Pour over ice in a collins glass, and serve.

name: Blue Hawaii
instructions: Blue Hawaii is a tasty recipe modified from a recipe on the reverse of a DeKuyper Blue Curacao bottle.

name: Blue Kool-Aid Punch
instructions: Make a liter of kool-aid mixture as standard. Add the raspberry vodka and raspberry sour puss, and stir. Pour into tall, ice-filled glasses, and serve.

name: Blue Solute
instructions: Mix ingredients in a highball glass, stir, and serve.

name: Body Bag
instructions: Pour the jagermeister into a shot glass, and fill with an equal amount of goldschlager. Serve.

name: Bomb Pop
instructions: Combine ingredients over ice in a small rocks glass, and serve.

name: Bong Water
instructions: Add all ingredients (except 7-up) to a highball glass with ice. Shake, top with 7-up, and serve.

name: Boom Boom Shot
instructions: Pour Bacardi Limon rum into a shot glass. Add Sprite (or 7-Up). Place a towel on the table and put one hand on top of the shot glass to seal it so that no liquid or gas from the soda escapes. Quickly slam the glass on the towel so that a lot of bubbles are made and consume so that you catch the bubbles going down your throat.

name: Boom Shaka Laka
instructions: Combine ingredients with ice in a margarita glass, mix, and serve.

name: Border Crosser
instructions: You can have a Border Crosser with both ordinary coke and cherry coke.

name: Boye Sparkle
instructions: One for the occasion. Boye Sparkle was created by Ronald Penaflor and Gloria Gahum of the philippines.

name: Brain Freeze #2
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender and blend until creamy or thick, as desired. Serve in a highball glass.

name: Braindead #2
instructions: Fill 2/3rds of a shot glass with white sambuca, and layer Kahlua down side of glass. Allow it to settle at the bottom. Drop in small amounts of advocaat and cherry advocaat. The advocaat will seperate giving the look of a brain. Using a straw suck out half of the concoction, shot the remainder then immediately cup your hand over the shot glass, insert the straw between you fingers and suck out the vapours.

name: Breath of God
instructions: Combine all ingredients together in a cocktail glass, stir, and serve.

name: Breda Blackout
instructions: Combine ingredients with ice in a highball glass. Stir and serve.

name: Bronsky
instructions: Pour ingredients over ice in a large brandy snifter, and serve.

name: Bubbilicous Grape
instructions: Open sherbert and dump the entire package of it into a punch bowl. Add grape soda, southern comfort and grape pucker. Stir, and serve out.

name: Bull Blaster
instructions: Pour a small can of red bull into a highball glass. Add jagermeister, and serve.

name: Bull Shit
instructions: Bull Shit (not bullshit) is a sweet, but decent shot.

name: Burnt Turkey
instructions: The Burnt Turkey is a favorite amongst imbibers in Iowa, where it was created by Anthony Underwood.

name: Caipirinha #2
instructions: A student by the name of Chris Loper of Montana State University sent in this alternative recipe to the Caipirinha. Glass sizes may vary, but the result will be the same - delicious!

name: Call a Cab
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in a hurricane glass with ice, or combine in a blender. Add juices and sprite to fill glass, and serve.

name: Campari and Ale
instructions: Campari and Ale invokes a gradient effect produced as the carbonated ginger ale sits on top of the Campari. This cocktail has been affectionately referred to as the "Crimson Gradient." Many enjoy its simplicity yet alluring tang and undescribable sweetness.

name: Campari and Soda
instructions: The Campari and Soda cocktail is popular on planes where the fruity, tangy flavor of the Campari refreshes your mouth, a treat when you are on long haul flights where you literally dry out due to the lack of humidity in the airline cabin.

name: Canadian Bull
instructions: The Canadian Bull is an invention originating near the University Of Rhode Island. Canadian Mist was originally used, but Crown is far classier.

name: Canadian Cowgirl
instructions: Pour whisky and yukon jack over ice in a cocktail glass. Add cola, garnish with a cherry, and serve.

name: Canadian Snake Bite
instructions: The Canadian Snake Bite originated in Montreal at the beginning of a bachelor party which finished in New York City. It was introduced to a couple of bartenders in NYC and it became popular like a Flaming Mo from the Simpsons.

name: Candy Cane Cola
instructions: Candy Cane Cola is the result of an experiment involving some peppermint schnapps and a Coke Slurpee.

name: Candy Corona
instructions: Best to add the grenadine straight into the bottle. Everyone will look at you and say, "Hey, where did you get a RED Corona?!".

name: Captain Butter Cream
instructions: Captain Butter Cream, as with many other Captain cocktails and the like, is hugely popular among Captain Morgan fans. Captain Butter Cream is tested with both IBC or A&W cream soda, and works great with both.

name: Carmel Nana
instructions: Pour DeKuyper Buttershots into a shot glass. Add 99 Bananas, stir, and serve.

name: Carmine
instructions: Pour Campari into a shot glass until half-full. Fill to the top with margarita mix, and serve.

name: Caribbean Milkshake
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender with crushed ice cubes, and blend well. Serve in a hurricane glass.

name: Cassis Orange
instructions: We have it on good authority that the Cassis Orange is a popular drink in Japan, and more so with the ladies.

name: Chambord Royale
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into a martini glass, and serve.

name: Chocolate Covered Cherry Jello Shots
instructions: This recipe takes two very popular recipes, Chocolate Covered Cherries and Jello Shots, and combines them to make a great dessert shot.

name: Chocolate Ravage
instructions: One glass of Chocolate Ravage will knock you down. The recipe was shared generously by Jon and Brandon. You can find the Pop-Ice at Walmart in the juice isle in a cardboard box for about $2. Chocolate Ravage has a chocolatey taste (due to Yoo-hoo chocolate milk) so your guests are sure to love it.

name: Citron and Seven
instructions: Pour one part citrus vodka into a tall glass. Add 2 parts (twice the amount) of 7-Up, and add lots of ice. Garnish with pieces of lemon and lime, and serve.

name: Clearly Vodkanadian
instructions: Mix one bottle Clearly Canadian flavored sparkling water with vodka in a 16 oz. collins glass.

name: Coast Colada
instructions: The Coast Colada recipe was made up by John Aquino at Coast Bar and Grille, Charleston, SC where it became their signature drink, and a popular one at that.

name: Coco Martini
instructions: Coco Martini is a popular recipe in Columbia, Missouri where Jake Maulin, a freelance college bartender concocted it.

name: Coco-Cognac
instructions: Pour cognac and creme de cacao into an 8 oz. pina colada glass over ice. Top with milk or cream. Garnish with a cherry and shaved chocolate/cocoa powder.

name: Coconut Dream #2
instructions: Pour ingredients over ice in a small highball or old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Cody Spunk
instructions: Pour Smirnoff vodka, Amaretto, Buttershots and milk into a cup and stir together. Top with cream and enjoy.

name: Cold Blood
instructions: Cold Blood is a great drink for hot summer nights. The cherry juice/vodka mixture used in the recipe is enough for between 8 - 12 servings.

name: College Hulk Punch
instructions: Add half bowl of ice to a punch bowl. Add the Bacardi 151 and Blue Curacao, and mix with the ice. Add the sweet and sour mix. Add orange juice until smooth to the taste and a really green cool color like the incredible hulk.

name: Confidence Builder
instructions: Confidence builder was invented by Kerry Jones for a man who asked for a drink to boost his confidence at a club on night. It seemed to pick up as a popular drink as time went on.

name: Cranberry Cooler
instructions: Mix ingredients together in a large container and freeze for approximately 24 hours. Pour into cocktail glasses when ready to serve.

name: Crazy Erika
instructions: Add all ingredients except sprite to a collins glass, and stir well to dissolve sugar. Add sprite, stir lightly, fill glass with ice amd serve.

name: Creamsicle #4
instructions: Place about 4 ice cubes in a cocktail glass. Pour in Absolut Citron and fill the glass around three-quarters of the way with orange juice. Top off with grenadine, stir and serve.

name: Creamsicle #5
instructions: Pour milk and orange juice into an old-fashioned glass. Pour rum into a shot glass. Drop the shot into the old-fashioned glass of orange juice and milk, and shoot.

name: Cremat
instructions: Cremat is a popular drink in Catalonia, north east of the Spanish peninsula. It is drunk along the Mediterranean Catalan coast, which is known as "Costa Brava". While it burns, people sing traditional songs called "habaneres". Probably Catalan sailors that traveled from Cuba invented it while on board.

name: Chronic
instructions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail glass, stir, and serve.

name: Crown and Choke
instructions: Pour the Crown Royal whisky into a shot glass. Pour the Bong Water into a seperate shot glass. Shoot the Crown, and chase with the Bong Water.

name: Cuban Assassin
instructions: Pour Bacardi 151 rum into a shot glass. Add chartreuse, then 5 or 6 dashes of tabasco sauce, and serve.

name: Cuban Lemur
instructions: Pour Bacardi 151 rum over ice in a highball glass. Add an equal amount of coca-cola. Squeeze in 2 lime slices, and serve.

name: Damage
instructions: Pour advocaat, rum and vodka into a shaker with ice. Shake well, pour over ice in a highball glass, and top with lemonade.

name: Dave Matthews
instructions: A popular recipe, particularly on the east coast of Canada. Apparently originated in Fredericton, New-Brunswick.

name: Dingo
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker and shake well. Strain over plenty of ice in a highball glass, garnish with an orange slice, and serve.

name: Dirty Panties
instructions: Pour tequila into a shot glass. Sprinkle parmesan cheese on top, and serve.

name: Dougle Do Me Now
instructions: A sweet tasting shot with a minimal burning sensation as it goes down the tube. Quite tasty.

name: Down Home Dew
instructions: Combine the Southern Comfort and the Mountain Dew in a jug. Pour in the two packs of koolaid. Stir or shake, and pour into highball glasses.

name: Dr. Dente
instructions: An old recipe, popular in parts of Southern California.

name: Dr. Funk
instructions: Add liquid ingredients to crushed ice in shaker. Cut limes in half and squeeze into shaker, dropping in the shells; add sugar. Shake well; pour the whole mess into a 12-oz chimney glass; fill rest of glass with charged water and decorate with fruit or freshly picked geranium leaf.

name: Dr. Malibu
instructions: Dr. Malibu was invented at a spring party in Kimball Nebraska when all but a bottle of Malibu rum and half a can of Dr. Pepper had been consumed.

name: Dragon Piss
instructions: Mix ingredients together in a whiskey sour glass, and serve.

name: Drunken Bunny
instructions: Blend first three ingredients together in a cocktail glass. The color should turn bright turquoise. Top with whipped cream, and serve.

name: Duck Sauce
instructions: Combine gin and orange juice in a small old-fashioned glass. Add a splash of both grenadine and ginger ale, stir and serve.

name: Dudi Drop
instructions: Dudi Drop is a highly original recipe served in an almost hollowed out strawberry. The inventor was a student, nicknamed Dudi, at the Ohio University in Athens, Ohio. Try to buy the largest strawberries there is, and try using an ice tray for preparing more than one strawberry at a time.

name: Egg Nog Captain Morgan
instructions: Pour rum into a small highball glass, and add egg nog. Stir together, top with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Elsinore Elbow
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a large shot glass, give a quick stir, and serve.

name: F-104
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker filled with crushed ice. Shake and strain into a chilled champagne glass, and serve.

name: False Whiskey Sour
instructions: We always use equal parts beer, whiskey, and frozen lemonade. Thaw and pour the lemonade concentrate into a pitcher, then fill up the cans with the whiskey and mix into the pitcher. Gently fill the cans with the beer, avoiding too much foam, and mix into the pitcher. Add the ice and stir.

name: Felcher
instructions: Pour Drambuie into a shot glass. Add some chocolate sprinkles or shavings. Top with whipped cream and add more chocolate sprinkles or shavings.

name: Fernet with Coke
instructions: Fernet with Coke is one of the most popular drinks in Argentina. The Coca-cola (or Coke) should be cold but the Fernet Branca can be at a normal temperature.

name: Festive Fuck
instructions: Mix schnapps together with tequila and grenadine in a shot glass, and serve.

name: Flaming Daniel
instructions: Combine ingredients together in an old-fashioned glass. Stir, ignite, and serve.

name: Flaming Jew
instructions: Mix ingredients together in a beer mug. Ignite, and serve.

name: Flaming Lemon
instructions: Squeeze half a lemon into a mixing glass, and add the Absolut Citron. Mix them together, and pour into a shot glass. Spoon the Everclear over the surface of the mixture, light on fire, and serve.

name: Flaming Mo
instructions: Pour Stoli peach vodka and Malibu rum into a shot glass. Top with enough 151 proof rum to be able to burn. Fill a pint glass with pineapple juice (right up to the level of the shot glass). Ignite the Stoli peach vodka/Malibu/151 mixture and allow to burn for a while. Pick up the burning shot glass, drop it into the pint glass and slam it.

name: Flaming Mouthwash
instructions: Pour the green creme de menthe into a shot glass. Add blue curacao, top with Everclear, and ignite. Take care, and extinguish before consuming.

name: Flaming Orgasm
instructions: Pour rum into a shot glass and the beer into a large mug. Light the rum on fire and drop into the beer. Make sure that the fire is out, then slam.

name: Folke West
instructions: The original recipe for Folke West, created on merchant ship Viking Gabriella by customer Petri Viinikainen in 2001 consists of Rhum de Martinique by Altia Oyj, Helsinki, Finland and also brown creme de cacao by the same makers. We recommend you look for these when possible.

name: Four Horsemen #3
instructions: The taste of this Four Horsemen recipe reminds most of Cinnaburst or Big Red gum, a very potent cinnimon flavor that will curl the hairs in your nose (and the person in the direct line of your exhale).

name: Freefall
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail glass, and stir. Decorate with a piece of pineapple and a cherry. Serve.

name: Freezer Burn
instructions: Chill the Smirnoff bottle on ice or in a refrigerator beforehand. Keep Hot Damn! at room temperature. Pour the Smirnoff vodka into a shot glass, and the Hot Damn! cinnamon schnapps into a seperate shot glass. Shoot the shot of vodka, and chase with the schnapps. Hence the name "Freezer burn".

name: Fuck Me Over Again
instructions: Pour triple sec, light rum and tequila into a highball glass over ice. Stir together, then add orange juice and ginger ale. Serve.

name: Fucked Up Motherfucker
instructions: Pour ingredients in equal parts into a shot glass, stir, and serve.

name: Fuzzy Delight
instructions: Pour Arrow peach schnapps into an ice-filled highball glass. Add Bacardi white rum, fill with Sunny Delight california style, and serve.

name: Fuzzy Peach
instructions: Build over ice in a highball glass, and serve.

name: Ganja Juice
instructions: Pour the vodka, 7-up, gatorade and hawaiian punch into a punch bowl, and stir. Add orange juice, stir and watch it turn green. Add ice, and serve to guests in highball glasses.

name: German Peach
instructions: Mix ingredients together in a cocktail glass over ice, and serve. Add more Rumple Minze to make it stronger or add seltzer water to make it weaker.

name: Get Her Done
instructions: Mix ingredients in equal parts over ice in a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Girls Night Out
instructions: A UK based drink originating in Ashby De La Zouch, Leicestershire, England. It has three Archers flavors, which you might not be able to find inside of the US.

name: Gold Rush
instructions: Pour equal parts of Goldschlager and Red Bull into a shot glass, and serve.

name: Goldfinger Martini
instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled martini glass.

name: Goldschlager Stinger
instructions: Pour Goldschl�ger into a shot glass. Add Sambuca, and serve.

name: Gonad
instructions: Layer ingredients above one another in a shot glass, by pouring over the back of a spoon pressed against the inside of the glass, or otherwise, and serve.

name: Green Hulk
instructions: Pour Hpnotiq and cognac into a shot glass, watch as it turns green, and serve.

name: Green Slime
instructions: Pour green Gatorade over a few ice cubes in a highball glass. Add Sprite, stir well, and serve for a fast and easy energy drink.

name: Green Tide
instructions: Green Tide was invented by the great people of the Mayan Palace resorts in Mexico. This drink is sinfully good.

name: Guava Gibbons
instructions: Mix Malibu rum and guava juice together in a highball glass filled with crushed ice. Add fresca to taste, and serve.

name: Guinness Cola
instructions: Pour half a bottle of Guinness into a beer mug, add an equal amount of Coca-cola, and serve.

name: Guthrie
instructions: Pour all liquors into a highball glass. Fill remainder of the glass with equal parts sweet and sour mix and Sprite or 7-Up.

name: Hairy Murry
instructions: Shake all ingredients together in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Hard Lemon Ice
instructions: Combine lemonade and vodka with ice in a blender. Blend until slurpee consistency, and pour into collins glasses topped with a touch of raspberry syrup.

name: Hardcore Gatorade
instructions: Mix together the Gatorade "Fierce" with Aftershock red cinnamon liqueur in a 12 or 16 ounce cup. Serve.

name: Harley Oil
instructions: Harley Oil is a popular drink with the biker crowds in South Bend, Indiana.

name: Haus Mix
instructions: Pour Black Haus blackberry schnapps over ice into an old-fashioned glass. Add Smirnoff vodka and cranberry juice, stir and serve.

name: Hawaiian Cool
instructions: Combine all ingredients together in a highball glass, stir, and serve.

name: Head Shrinker
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a highball glass or Tiki mug, and serve.

name: HeadSpinner
instructions: Pour peach schnapps into a collins glass filled with ice. Fill with Sprite or 7-Up, and serve.

name: Hennessy and Coke
instructions: Pour Hennessy cognac into a large collins glass filled with ice. Add Coca-cola, stir lightly, and serve.

name: Hennessy Martini
instructions: Pour Hennessy cognac into a cocktail shaker with ice. Add a squeeze of a lemon wedge, and stir together. Strain into a chilled martini cocktail glass, garnish with lemon peel, and serve.

name: Hilty Dilty
instructions: Shake ingredients together with crushed ice in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Hobble Gobble
instructions: Bacardi to make you hobble and turkey to make you gobble.

name: Hong Kong Smog
instructions: Pour Tanqueray gin and Midori melon liqueur into a shaker half-filled with ice. Stir or shake well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with a melon ball, and serve.

name: Hooker
instructions: Pour Alize Gold Passion and Tropicana simultaneously over a few ice cubes in a cocktail glass, and serve. Alternatively, blend together with ice in a blender for a frozen drink.

name: Horny Schoolgirl
instructions: Pour ingredients over plenty of ice in a highball glass. Stir, and serve.

name: Hot Tub
instructions: Pour cranberry juice over ice in a tall glass. Add the Grand Marnier, Absolut, Champagne and Chambord. Garnish with a cherry, and serve.

name: Hurricane Boston
instructions: Hurricane Boston is a simplified version of the popular New Orleans classic, the Hurricane.

name: Hyped Up Mu
instructions: Pour brandy over ice in a beer mug or pint glass. Add root beer, stir, and serve.

name: Hpnotiq Breeze
instructions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker, and shake. Strain over ice into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.

name: I Like To Drink
instructions: Pour ingredients into a jug. Add one slush puppie, and stir. Pour into shot glasses and add sprinkles on top. Chase with a doughnut.

name: Ice Chest Lemonade
instructions: Microwave the limes and lemons for about 10 - 15 seconds in order to release the juice. Cut in half. Pour the ice into an ice chest. Add lemonade or limeade, sugar and squeeze in the juice from all the lemons and limes. Add vodka to taste. Grab the handles and shake.

name: Irish Catholic
instructions: Pour ingredients in equal parts into a shot glass, and serve.

name: Italian Stallion #2
instructions: This recipe for an Italian Stallion was created circa 2001 by J. Steve. Mayo, with final tweeks courtesy of an Absolut representative at the Vodka-Tasting-Event in Seattle, Washington.

name: Jackson Jack
instructions: Pour Yukon Jack into a beer mug filled with ice. Fill with ginger ale, and serve.

name: Jag and Red
instructions: Pour a 8 oz can of Red Bull into a highball glass. Add jagermeister, and serve.

name: Jager Monster Shot
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice in a shaker, strain into a shot glass and serve.

name: Jeff Boxies
instructions: Mix green creme de menthe and kahlua with milk in a coffee mug, and serve.

name: Jimmy.A Special
instructions: Pour the liqueurs into a cocktail glass. Add lemonade, and serve.

name: Jojo
instructions: Pour ingredients over ice in a highball glass, and serve.

name: Jose and Ginger
instructions: Pour Jose Cuervo gold tequila into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Add ginger ale, stir, and serve.

name: Kellikilla
instructions: Pour Midori melon liqueur over ice in a highball glass. Add Sprite, pineapple juice and cranberry juice on top.

name: Tie Me To The Bedpost #3
instructions: Mix ingredients together over ice in a whiskey sour glass, and serve.

name: Klukwan
instructions: Mix Bacardi Razz with Sprite over ice cubes in a highball glass, and serve.

name: Kryptonite
instructions: Combine ingredients with ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Lava Lamp
instructions: Pour a shot of DeKuyper raspberry pucker schnapps into a shot glass. Place the shot glass inside the bottom of a pint glass. Pour Bacardi silver rum around the outside of shot glass (but inside the pint glass) and carefully float some on top of the raspberry pucker by pouring over the back of a spoon pressed against the inside of the shot glass. Top it all off with Guinness. If done correctly, all ingredients should stay separated until the drink is downed in one fell swoop.

name: Lemon Kvas
instructions: A recipe for Lemon Kvas, a Ukrainian delicacy.

name: Lemonberry Twist
instructions: Pour ingredients as listed above into a collins glass filled with ice, and serve.

name: Life Is Good
instructions: Pour Stoli Razberi and Sprite into a highball glass. Add a splash of cranberry juice and Red Bull energy drink, stir, and serve.

name: Light Flow
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and serve over ice in a cocktail glass.

name: Limey Bellows
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a shot glass, and serve.

name: Liquid Zanex
instructions: Mix ingredients together in a shot glass, and serve.

name: Long Happiness
instructions: Muddle in the bottom of a boston shaker the ginger and pineapple. Add vodka, gin, and pineapple juice. Shake and strain into a collins glass, top with ginger beer, garnish with a slice of pineapple, and serve.

name: Long Island Taxi
instructions: A popular cocktail at the Lakewood Lounge, Kansas City, Mo, where Long Island Taxi originated via a guy named Matt.

name: Lunchpail
instructions: Pour beer and orange juice into a pint glass. Drop a shot glass filled with amaretto into the pint glass, and chug.

name: Machetazo
instructions: Poor the Guinness into a large beer mug. Drop two shot glasses, filled with kahlua and rum respectively, into the guinness and down in one fell swoop.

name: Malibu Bomber
instructions: Pour Malibu rum over ice in a whiskey sour glass. Add orange juice and cranberry juice, and splash with key largo schnapps. Stir, and serve.

name: Malibu Sunset
instructions: Pour Malibu rum into an ice-filled hurricane glass. Add pineapple juice and orange juice. Top off with a splash of cranberry juice, garnish with a cherry, and serve.
