instructions: Pour the Stoli pepper vodka (Pertsovka), tomato juice and orange juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass with a small amount of crushed ice, and serve.

name: Newbury Cocktail
instructions: Pour the gin, sweet vermouth and triple sec into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: New Orleans Martini
instructions: Pour the Stoli vanilla vodka (Vanil), dry vermouth, Pernod and Angostura bitters into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint, and serve.

name: New York Motherfucker
instructions: Pour the vodka, rum, gin and Kahlua coffee liqueur into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with cream as desired, and serve.

name: Nice Melons
instructions: Combine the light rum, watermelon pieces, lime juice and peach in a blender with one cup of crushed ice. Blend well, and pour into a hurricane glass. Add a straw, and serve.

name: Nick at Night
instructions: Pour the Jose Cuervo gold tequila, peach schnapps, sour mix and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a collins glass, and serve.

name: Nickel
instructions: Pour the Absolut Kurant, Midori melon liqueur and orange juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a highball glass. Fill with cold 7-up, and serve.

name: Nickel Alloy
instructions: Pour the Absolut Kurant, Cointreau and orange juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a highball glass. Fill with cold 7-up, and serve.

name: Nickel Fever
instructions: Pour the blue curacao, Southern Comfort, galliano, cream and orange juice into a mixing glass half-filled with cracked ice. Stir well. Strain into a champagne saucer. Garnish with ice chips and 8-10 drops of blue curacao, and serve.

name: Night Cap
instructions: Pour the rum into an Irish coffee mug and fill with warm milk. Sweeten to taste. Stir, sprinkle with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Night Light
instructions: Combine all three ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Nijinski Blini
instructions: Pour all ingredients over some crushed ice in a champagne flute. Stir gently, and serve.

name: Nineteenth Hole
instructions: Stir the gin, dry vermouth, sweet vermouth and bitters with cracked ice in a mixing glass. Strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with an olive, and serve.

name: No Clue
instructions: Pour the vodka, triple sec and Dr. Pepper into a collins glass 3/4 filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and serve.

name: Nog De Cacao
instructions: Stir ingredients together with cracked ice in an old-fashioned glass. Sprinkle with cocoa, and serve.

name: Moose Martini
instructions: Shake both ingredients with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with juniper berries macerated in vermouth, and serve.

name: Northern Lights
instructions: Pour the Absolut vodka, raspberry liqueur and orange-pineapple juice into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and serve.

name: Not So Fuzzy Navel
instructions: Pour the peach schnapps, orange juice and grapefruit juice over crushed ice in a collins glass. Garnish with a slice of orange or lime, and serve.

name: Nuclear Kool-Aid
instructions: Pour ingredients in order into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Nuclear Slush
instructions: Fill a blender about 3/4 with crushed ice and add liqueurs. Mix and add the sour mix until the mixture funnels in the blender. The final result should be thick. Add more ice if necessary. Pour into a hurricane glass, and serve.

name: Nuclear Zima
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a highball glass 3/4 filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and serve.

name: Nuclear Blue
instructions: Pour the blue curacao, Southern Comfort and Wild Turkey whiskey into a highball glass with a few ice cubes. Fill with lime mix, and serve.

name: Nut Case
instructions: Pour the light rum, Frangelico hazelnut liqueur, amaretto almond liqueur and lime juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Nutty Colada
instructions: Combine the amaretto, coconut milk and crushed pineapple with two cups of crushed ice in a blender. Blend on high for a short period and pour into a collins glass. Add a straw, and serve.

name: Nutty Martini
instructions: Pour the vodka and Frangelico hazelnut liqueur into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Nutty-Tini
instructions: Pour the vodka, amaretto almond liqueur, Frangelico hazelnut liqueur and cream into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Oakland Cocktail
instructions: Pour the vodka, dry vermouth and orange juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Nude Ell Cocktail
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Ohrangarita
instructions: Pour the Stoli orange vodka (Ohranj), triple sec, sour mix and orange juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Ohranj Blossom
instructions: Pour the Stoli orange vodka (Ohranj), triple sec, orange juice and sugar syrup into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Ohranj Juice
instructions: Pour the Stoli orange vodka (Ohranj), peach schnapps and cranberry juice into an old-fashioned glass 1/2 filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and serve.

name: Ohranj Julius
instructions: Pour the Stoli orange vodka (Ohranj), triple sec, sour mix and orange juice into a cocktail glass over crushed ice. Garnish with a slice of orange, and serve.

name: Ohranj Screwdriver
instructions: Pour the Stoli orange vodka (Ohranj), orange juice and lemon juice into an old-fashioned glass half-filled with cracked ice. Stir well, and serve.

name: Ojen Cocktail
instructions: Pour the ojen, peychaud bitters, sugar and water into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Oklahoma Cooler
instructions: Pour the melon deoria, Skyy vodka and cranberry juice into a cocktail glass. Add the 7-up, and stir gently. Garnish with a slice of lime and a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Old Country Martini
instructions: Pour the vodka, madeira wine and cherry brandy into a mixing glass half-filled with cracked ice. Stir well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange twist, and serve.

name: Old Etonian
instructions: Pour the gin, Lillet, orange bitters and creme de noyaux into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of orange peel, and serve.

name: Old Fashioned Manhattan
instructions: Pour the whiskey, sweet vermouth, bitters and sugar into a cocktail glass over crushed ice. Stir well. Top with club soda, and stir again gently. Garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Old Yeller
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into a cocktail glass, garnish with a slice of lemon, and serve.

name: Opening Night
instructions: Pour the whiskey, Martini & Rossi dry vermouth and strawberry liqueur into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Oral Sex on the Beach
instructions: Pour the vodka, peach schnapps, blue curacao and pineapple juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a highball glass, and serve.

name: Orang-A-Tang
instructions: Pour the vodka, triple sec, orange juice, sour mix and grenadine into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a large brandy snifter half-filled with ice. Float the Bacardi 151 on top, garnish with tropical fruit, and serve.

name: Orange Beam
instructions: Pour the Jim Beam bourbon whiskey into an old-fashioned glass 3/4 filled with ice cubes. Fill with orange soda, and serve.

name: Olive Martini
instructions: Pour the dry gin, sweet vermouth and olive brine into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Orange Bloom
instructions: Combine all three ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Orange Blossom Special
instructions: Combine all ingredients with 6 ice cubes in a blender. Blend until smooth, and pour into a parfait glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry and a slice of orange, and serve.

name: Orange Creamsicle
instructions: Pour advocaat into an old-fashioned glass half-filled with cracked ice. Add 7-Up or Sprite to taste, stir gently, and serve.

name: Orange Fizz
instructions: Add the gin, lemon juice, triple sec, simple syrup and orange bitters to a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a sour glass. Fill with soda, and top with orange juice. Garnish with a slice of orange, and serve.

name: Orange Jeff
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth, pour into a hurricane glass. Garnish with slices or pieces of tropical fruit, add a straw, and serve.

name: Orange Martini
instructions: Pour the vodka, triple sec and orange bitters into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange twist, and serve.

name: Orange Smartie
instructions: Pour the vodka, Kahlua coffee liqueur and triple sec into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Add orange juice to taste. Shake well, pour contents into a highball glass, and serve.

name: Orange Smasha
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender with crushed ice. Blend until smooth; add more ice as required. Pour into a highball glass, add a straw, and serve.

name: Orange Splash
instructions: Layer ingredients, in above order, into a tall glass half-filled with ice cubes. Add a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Orchid Cocktail
instructions: Pour the gin, violet liqueur and egg white into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Oregon Special
instructions: Pour the white rum over several ice cubes in a highball glass. Almost fill the glass with sweet and sour mix. Add the orange juice, and dash grenadine. Garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Orgasm #4
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a highball glass, and serve.

name: Orgasm #5
instructions: Pour the vodka, amaretto, Kahlua coffee liqueur and light cream into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a highball glass, and serve.

name: Orgasm #9
instructions: Pour all three ingredients over cracked ice in an old-fashioned glass, stir and serve.

name: Orgasm #10
instructions: Build ingredients in above order in a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Original Old Fashioned
instructions: Pour the sugar, bitters and water into a mixing glass half-filled with cracked ice. Stir well until dissolved. Pour over cracked ice in an old-fashioned glass, and stir in the bourbon whiskey. Garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Original Singapore Sling
instructions: Combine the gin, cherry brandy and lime juice in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Drop the benedictine and brandy into the centre of the drink, and serve.

name: Orthoniatis
instructions: Pour the kiwi liqueur, Bacardi white rum and pineapple juice into a cocktail shaker with 5 ice cubes. Shake well, pour into a collins glass, and serve.

name: Osaka Dry
instructions: Pour the vodka and sake into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a picked plum, and serve.

name: Oscar Cocktail
instructions: Add ingredients to a snifter filled with ice. Garnish with an orange wedge and a stemmed cherry.

name: Outhouse Slammer
instructions: Pour the beer and Coca-cola into a pint glass. Fill a shot glass with everclear and ignite (carefully). Drop the burning shot of everclear into the beer-coke mixture, and chug.

name: Out of the Blue
instructions: Combine ingredients with 1-2 cups of crushed ice in a blender, until smooth. Pour into a hurricane glass, add a straw, and serve.

name: Overcast Friday
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake vigorously. Pour into a highball glass over several ice cubes. Add a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Padas Battery
instructions: Pour all ingredients into an old-fashioned glass filled with cracked ice. Stir well, and serve.

name: Padas Passoa
instructions: Pour all ingredients into an old-fashioned glass filled with cracked ice. Stir well, and serve.

name: Over the Rainbow
instructions: Combine all ingredients with one cup of crushed ice in a blender. Blend until smooth, and pour into a parfait glass. Garnish with a strawberry and a slice of peach, and serve.

name: Paddy Cocktail
instructions: Shake all three ingredients with ice in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pall Mall Cocktail
instructions: Stir the gin, vermouths and creme de cacao together in an old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Pall Mall Martini
instructions: Stir the gin, vermouths, creme de menthe and orange bitters together in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Palm Beacher
instructions: Pour the dark rum, amaretto and orange juice into an old-fashioned glass 3/4 filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Pamir Peach
instructions: Pour the Stoli peach vodka (Persik). Amaretto Di Saronno, orange juice and lemon juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, strain into a chilled old-fashioned glass over several ice cubes, and serve.

name: Palm Breeze
instructions: Pour the vodka and peach schnapps into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Fill with equal amounts of orange juice and blue hawaiian punch, and serve.

name: Panty Remover
instructions: Stir ingrediients together in a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Panty Remover #2
instructions: Freeze the pineapple chunks. Place them into a tall glass, add the gin, pineapple juice and mountain dew, and serve.

name: Papa Muminek
instructions: Pour the Canadian whisky, advocaat, creme de cacao, Tia Maria coffee liqueur, creme de bananes, milk and apple juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and pour entire contents into a hurricane glass. Garnish with a slice of orange and a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Paradise Cafe
instructions: Pour the spiced rum and hot coffee into a mug, and sweeten to taste. Top with whipped cream, and serve.

name: Paradise Quencher
instructions: Pour the rum, fruit juices and apricot liqueur into a blender. Add one cup of crushed ice. Blend well, and pour into a hurricane glass. Garnish with a slice of lime and a fruit flag, and serve.

name: Paraflu Cocktail
instructions: Pour the vodka and lemon juice (to taste) into a cocktail glass filled with ice. Slowly pour the blue curacao to the bottom of the glass, and serve.

name: Parisian Pousse Cafe
instructions: Layer the ingredients in order into a pousse-cafe glass, and serve.

name: Parkeroo
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a small champagne flute. Garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Parrothead Martini
instructions: Pour the silver tequila, triple sec and fresh lime juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lime, and serve.

name: Party Starter
instructions: Pour the Cointreau, lemon juice, lime juice and bitters into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Passion Cocktail
instructions: Add the coconut rum, white rum and sugar to a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a collins glass. Fill with equal amounts of sour mix and pineapple juice, pre-chilled. Top with Sprite, and serve.

name: Passionate Rita
instructions: Pour all three ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Passionate Strap
instructions: Combine all ingredients together with crushed ice in a blender, and blend well. Pour into a parfait glass. Garnish with an open strawberry pressed onto the edge of the glass, and serve.

name: Passionate Sunset
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a collins glass filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Passion Colada
instructions: Pour the white rum, cream, passion-fruit juice and coconut syrup into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and pour into a pina colada glass. Garnish with a pineapple chunk or a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Passion Pussy
instructions: Pour the La Grande Passion liqueur, grenadine and heavy cream into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake vigorously, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pavlova Peach
instructions: Pour the Stoli peach vodka (Persik), cranberry juice and orange juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and pour entire contents into a double old-fashioned glass with several ice cubes. Garnish with a peach slice, and serve.

name: Pavlova Supreme
instructions: Pour the vodka and creme de cassis into a red wine glass filled with finely shaven ice, and serve.

name: Peaceful Treasure
instructions: Pour the dark rum, citrus juices, simple syrup and grenadine into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and serve.

name: Peach Blossom
instructions: Pour the vodka and peach schnapps into a collins glass filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Fill with ginger ale, stir again gently, and serve.

name: Peach Blossom Martini
instructions: Pour the Stoli peach vodka (Persik), Dubonnet Rouge and maraschino liqueur into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of peach, and serve.

name: Peach Cider
instructions: Pour the DeKuyper Peachtree schnapps and apple cider into a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir gently, and serve.

name: Peach Melba Freeze
instructions: Combine the peach schnapps, black-raspberry liqueur, hazelnut liqueur, vanilla ice cream, light cream and raspberry jam in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pourinto a parfait glass, garnish with a peach slice, and serve.

name: Peach Sangaree
instructions: Pour the peach brandy into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Fill with club soda, and stir gently. Float the port on top. Dust with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Peach Tumbler
instructions: Stir all ingredients together with a few ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass or tumbler, and serve.

name: Peachy Amaretto
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a 12-oz parfait glass filled with finely shaven ice, and serve.

name: Peachy Blue
instructions: Pour the peach schnapps and blue curacao into a mixing glass half-filled with cracked ice. Stir well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Peachy Colada
instructions: Pour the spiced rum, peach schnapps, coconut cream and pineapple juice into a blender with two cups of crushed ice. Blend until slushy, pour into a hurricane glass, and serve.

name: Peach Cicel
instructions: Add the peach schnapps, vanilla schnapps, peach sherbet and sliced peach to a blender, and blend well. Pour into a cocktail glass, and top with whipped cream. Garnish with a maraschino cherry and serve.

name: Peachy Grace
instructions: Combine the rum, triple sec and 1/2 a peach (cut into quarters) in a blender. Blend and pour into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Fill with sweet and sour mix, and serve.

name: Peachy Martini
instructions: Pour the Stoli strawberry vodka (Strasberi) and peach brandy into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Peep Show
instructions: Pour the Dubonnet, brandy, pernod and lime juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Peggy Martini
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a mixing glass half-filled with cracked ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pelvic Crusher
instructions: Pour the apple pucker and vodka into a highball glass filled with cracked or cubed ice. Fill with zima, stir gently and serve.

name: Peachy Screw
instructions: Pour the Absolut vodka, peach schnapps, Malibu rum and grenadine into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Add sour mix and orange juice to taste. Shake well, and strain into a collins glass filled with ice cubes. Garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Penis Colarous
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, pour entire contents into a highball glass, and serve.

name: Pepperclear
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a highball glass, and serve.

name: Pepper Manhattan
instructions: Pour the Stoli pepper vodka (Pertsovka) and sweet vermouth into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Peppermint Hot Chocolate
instructions: Pour the peppermint schnapps into an Irish coffee cup/mug, add the hot chocolate, and stir. Top with whipped cream, garnish with some peppermint candy, and serve.

name: Peppermint Martini
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint, and serve.

name: Peppermint Park
instructions: Pour the gin and lemon juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a large champagne flute. Top with champagne, add a straw, and serve.

name: Peppermint Penguin
instructions: Combine the green creme de menthe, chocolate mint liqueur, cookies and cream with one cup of crushed ice in a blender. Blend until smooth and pour into a parfait glass. Top with whipped cream. Garnish with a chocolate cookie and a cherry, and serve.

name: Peppermint Pleasure
instructions: Stir ingredients together in an old-fashioned glass over cracked ice, and serve.

name: Peppertini
instructions: Pour the Stoli pepper vodka (Pertsovka) and dry vermouth into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and pour into an old-fashioned glass over several ice cubes. Garnish with an olive, and serve.

name: Pep Up
instructions: Pour the peppermint schnapps into a highball glass. Fill with 7-up, stir gently, and serve.

name: Perfect Screw
instructions: Pour the Harvest pear schnapps, orange juice and vodka into a highball glass, in that order. Serve.

name: Pesticidal Cherries
instructions: Add the grenadine to the tonic water in a mixing glass, and mix well. Add the cherry cola and one shot of vodka at the same time. Place the 5 cherries in a seperate shot of vodka and soak for at least 10 minutes (cherries can be soaked in advance and kept in the refrigerator). Remove cherries and add this shot of vodka to the mixing glass. Stir, strain into a collins glass, and serve. Garnish with some more cherries, and serve.

name: Phantasmic Explosion
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a collins glass filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and serve.

name: Phillip Island Firewater
instructions: Stir ingredients together in an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Pillow Biter
instructions: Pour the bourbon whiskey and peach schnapps into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a powder-rimmed highball glass. Add a twist of citrus fruit for flavor, and serve.

name: Physcadelic Summer
instructions: Pour the Parfait Amour, Malibu rum, Cointreau, blue curacao and grenadine into a blender with half a cup of crushed ice. Blend until smooth. Pour into a large sugar-rimmed cocktail glass. Drizzle grenadine over the top, garnish with a slice of lemon or lime, and serve.

name: Pimp Daddy
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a beer mug filled with ice cubes. Garnish with a slice of lemon, and serve.

name: Pina Colada Royal
instructions: Place the rums, crushed pineapple and ice cream in a blender with 1 1/2 cups of crushed ice. Blend until frozen; add more ice if required. Pour into a parfait glass, and serve.

name: Pineapple Banana Refresher
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth, and pour into a highball glass. Garnish with a pineapple wedge and a slice of banana, and serve.

name: La Rosa
instructions: Pour the Scotch whisky, Chambord raspberry liqueur and Ocean Spray cranberry juice cocktail into a cocktail glass with crushed ice. Add a small squeeze of fresh lime juice and stir gently. Garnish with a lime wedge, and serve.

name: 151 Reasons
instructions: Stir together in a highball glass filled with ice cubes, and serve.
Pour both ingredients into a shot glass in equal parts, and serve.

name: 8-Ounce Twista
instructions: Mix 2 ounces of each ingredient in a cocktail shaker/stirrer very well. Pour into a highball glass with 3-4 ice cubes, and serve. Ensure all juices are 100% pure, and not concentrated or sweetened.

name: Apples and Oranges
instructions: Stir ingredients together gently in a highball glass, and serve.

name: Atomic Plum
instructions: Add all ingredients (except 151 rum) to a cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes and shake vigorously for 15-20 seconds. Pour into a large shot glass, splash with 151 rum and shoot.

name: Bahama Breeze
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender with 2-3 ice cubes. Pour over ice cubes in a tall glass. Garnish with an orange wedge and a cherry, and serve.

name: Bahama Mama NC
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, and shake well. Pour into a pina-colada glass filled with crushed or cubed ice, and serve.

name: Banana Split Martini
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a martini cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pina Colada #3
instructions: Crush your ice into a blender. Add the Malibu, crushed pineapple, and coconut as above. Blend until smooth, pour into a pina-colada glass, and serve.

name: Blues Night
instructions: Pour the vodka and blue curacao into a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes. Top up with 7-Up or Sprite. Sprinkle salt on top, stir with a stick or straw, remove and serve.

name: Bocktail
instructions: Bocktail is a very popular drink from Belgium, invented by a Mr. Bock in Ghent.

name: Butterscotch Ice Cream
instructions: A creamy recipe which tastes very similar to butterscotch-flavored ice cream.

name: Cape Cod #2
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a collins glass half-filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Cherry Fucker
instructions: Stir the DeKuyper Sour Apple Pucker and Chambord raspberry liqueur together with the pine-apple juice over ice in a small collins glass. Garnish with 2 cherries, and serve.

name: Cluster Fuck
instructions: Pour the tennessee whiskey, kentucky bourbon, tequila, rum and vodka into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a highball glass. Add the butterscotch and apple schnapps, and serve.

name: Corkscrew #2
instructions: Softly stir ingredients together in a highball glass filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Crossbones
instructions: Chill the jagermeister and rumplemintz in a cocktail shaker with ice, and strain into a shot glass. Top with everclear, and serve.

name: Dead Baby Boy
instructions: Dead Baby Boy is a drink referenced from the film "Man Bites Dog", although the true origin is unknown.

name: Dennis the Menace
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a double-shot glass and serve.

name: Desert Bastard
instructions: Stir all ingredients together in an old-fashioned glass, and shoot.

name: Dr. Pepper Flame
instructions: Pour the Amaretto almond liqueur into a shot glass leaving at least a quarter-inch of space at the top. Slowly pour the Bacardi 151 rum on top. Have a full cup or glass of Dr. Pepper ready. Ignite the 151 rum in the shot glass, and drop the flaming shot glass into the Dr. Pepper. Drink immediately.

name: Ectoplasm
instructions: The Ectoplasm is a hideous-looking green drink resembling the green slime from Ghostbusters. It also has a kick like a mule.

name: Electric Lemonade #2
instructions: Pour the vodka, gin, rum and blue curacao into a chilled collins glass. Top off with lemonade, stir and serve.

name: Eraser
instructions: Stir ingredients together with a couple of ice cubes in a collins glass, and serve.

name: Felix Longwater
instructions: Pour all three ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into an old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Fire and Ice
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a shot glass in equal parts, and serve.

name: Fisting in a Mexican Prison
instructions: Shake the tequila, cranberry juice and the lime juice in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Strain into a salt-rimmed cocktail glass with a lime wedge, and serve.

name: A Tropical Dream
instructions: Combine all ingredients (except grenadine) together over ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake and strain into a hurricane glass filled with ice. Float grenadine on top, and serve.

name: Big Dumb Russian #2
instructions: This was inspiried by the original "Big Dumb Russian". It uses Blue Curacao instead.

name: Creme Soda
instructions: Stir ingredients gently together in a chilled cocktail glass with a small amount of crushed ice, and serve.

name: Flame Blazer
instructions: Pour the extra dry vermouth, 1-oz only of vodka, Campari bitters and 1-oz only of orange juice into a cocktail shaker with 5 ice cubes. Shake for 10 seconds. Add the remaining 3-oz of orange juice, 1-oz only of cranberry juice, lemon cordial and stir. Strain into a jug. Add the absinthe and ignite. Allow the flame to extinguish by itself. Take the ice leftover from the cocktail shaker, place in a plastic bag, and crush with a blunt object like a hammer handle. Place back into the cocktail shaker, add the Midori melon liqueur, the remaining 1-oz of vodka and the remaining 1-oz of cranberry juice. Shake for 15 seconds. Fill a highball glass half-way with the entire contents of the cocktail shaker. Add the mixture from the jug, and top with grenadine. Stir, garnish with a lemon slice and serve with a straw.

name: Flaming Tiki Torch
instructions: Place 2 highball glasses next to each other, one right side up, and one upside down. Stack a shot glass on on in between the two highball glasses. Combine the Malibu rum, peach schnapps, and pineapple juice in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes, and shake well. Fill the right side up tall glass half way with Smirnoff Ice. Pour the contents of your cocktail shaker into the shot glass. Add a splash of Razzmatazz and 151 to the shot glass. Next step is optional; either light the top of the shot with a match, or blow fire at it with 151 in your mouth. Then, knock the shot glass into the tall glass and serve.

name: Freddy Kreuger
instructions: Pour scotch and tequila into a large shot glass. Add hot sauce, morton salt and shoot.

name: Fresh Melon Martini
instructions: Cut up both melons and add to blender. Blend well and strain. Add Skyy melon vodka to a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Add about 2-4 oz of the blended melon juice. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Add a melon ball for garnish, and serve.

name: Fuzzy Iron Worker
instructions: Shake all ingredients together in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a double-shot glass, and serve.

name: Fuzzy Worm
instructions: Fill in order into shot glass.

name: Sally Fudpucker
instructions: Pour the tequila and pink grapefuit juice into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Pouring slowly and carefully over the back of a teaspoon, float the galliano on top of the drink, and serve.
Pour the Strongbow cider and V energy drink in equal parts into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir briefly, and serve.

name: 357 Magnum
instructions: Pour the Bacardi 151 rum into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Add the vodka and amaretto. Fill with 7-up, and serve.

name: 73 Bus
instructions: Mix all three ingredients with ice in a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: A Clockwork Tangerine
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a beef pilsner. Stir together, and serve.

name: Tiki Rum
instructions: Tiki rum can be made with mango or pineapple Malibu rum.

name: Absolute Monster
instructions: Combine the Absolut vanilla vodka, Monster energy drink and ice cubes in a blender. Blend until slushy, pour into a highball glass, and serve.

name: Absolute Suicide
instructions: Chill each ingredient. Pour into a shot glass in equal parts, and serve.

name: Acapulco Dream Cream
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and pour into a cocktail glass. Dust with cinnamon, and serve.

name: Acid Water
instructions: Pour the Bacardi, Moonshine and Everclear into an old-fashioned or highball glass. Add the 7-up, stir briefly, and serve.

name: African on Acid
instructions: Pour the watermelon vodka and Midori melon liqueur into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake briefly, strain into a double-sized shot glass, and serve.

name: African Tinnie
instructions: The African Tinnie has unknown origins, but was first served to the contributor in a club in Auckland NZ just over 10 yrs ago. It has a taste like a cola popsicle/ice block.

name: After Work Special
instructions: Pour the Di Amore amaretto, Malibu rum and Bacardi rum over 5 ice cubes in a hurricane glass. Fill the rest of the glass with orange juice and pineapple juice, to taste, and serve.

name: Alcoholic Jolly Rancher
instructions: The Alcoholic Jolly Rancher is an extremely potent but very very delicious recipe, so drink responsibly. Invented by Phil in Taunton, Massachusetts.

name: Alize Emerald
instructions: Combine both ingredients in equal parts in an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Alligator Sperm
instructions: Pour equal parts of Midori melon liqueur and pineapple juice into a shot glass. Top off with a touch of cream, and serve.

name: Anchors Away
instructions: Combine all ingredients together in a blender with ice. Blend on high until smooth, pour into a hurricane glass, and serve.

name: Apple 151
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a mug with ice, and serve.

name: Apple Jell-o Shots
instructions: Mix the boiling water with the single package of sour apple jell-o. Stir for 2 minutes until all dissolved. Add 2 cups of DeKuyper Sour Apple Pucker schnapps, and mix well. Pour into small cups with lids and let set overnight. Serve, preferably at parties.

name: Apple Shooter
instructions: Apple Shooter is based on a frozen drink called an Apple Sour Martini made at Macaroni Grill that used shaved ice. This turned out to be much better as I tried to copy it at home. It turns out to be a sweet, refreshing, and strong apple-flavored shooter.

name: Apple Spritzer
instructions: Pour the apple juice into the old-fashioned glass filled previously with 3 to 5 ice cubes and add the soda. Stir before you serve. You can mix the juice and the soda in the fifty-fifty percent relation too, but it is faster energy-delivering and even healthier my way.

name: Applegasm
instructions: Applegasm was appreciatively contributed by the originators, a pair of college students who thoroughly enjoy apples and social drinking as opposed to getting sloshed immediately.

name: Apricot Kiss
instructions: Pour the apricot brandy, Scotch whisky and sweet vermouth into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Stir gently and serve.

name: Attempted Suicide
instructions: Cut the cantaloupe melon into small pieces. Mix all alcohol and fruit juice in a large container such as a cooler. Slice the fruit and place in the alcohol and let marinate. Serve in a tall glass with ice and fruit as garnish.

name: Bacardi Daug
instructions: Pour the Hennessy cognac into a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes. Add the Bacardi Silver rum, top with the Coca-cola, stir briefly and serve.

name: Bacardi Remix
instructions: Pour a glass of sprite remix into a large highball glass or any other good useful cup then add Bacardi O. Stir, add a twist or piece of orange for flavor, and serve.

name: Bald Estonian
instructions: Pour the tequila, Vana Tallin cream liqueur and vodka into a highball glass. Add the milk and cocoa powder and stir everything together. Serve with a drinkstick.

name: Banana Grape Smoothie
instructions: Place the bananas and grapes into a blender and mix until it is a "smooth" liquid. Add the ice and blend until crushed. Add milk, mix until smooth and pour into a hurricane glass. Serve.

name: Barber Chair Shot
instructions: Pour equal amounts of tequila and margarita mix into separate shot glasses. Lay person back in barber shop chair. Lay towl on chest of that person. Someone is to stand behind that person and pour the shots in to that persons mouth. They close and swish to blend and drink.

name: Barney on Acid Highball
instructions: Build ingredients on ice in a highball glass, and serve.

name: Bart Simpson #2
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well, strain into shot glasses, and serve.

name: Beetle Juice
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker over ice. Close the shaker and shake briskly two or three times. Strain into a large (9-oz) martini or cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Beaubetween
instructions: Three friends invented the Beaubetween around a campfire in Northern Ontario. It was originally called "Cleavage" however took on its new name which is not so obvious (Beau means nice).

name: Beautiful Side Ride
instructions: Pour the cognac, Grand Marnier and triple sec into a highball glass in that order. Add sweet and sour mix and Sprite (or 7-Up) lemon-lime soda, both to taste. Serve.

name: Beevo Special
instructions: Beevo Special, invented by Chris Bivens (AKA Beevo), named by Tom Atkins, is a popular drink in the western Chicago Suburbs.

name: Belizan Punch
instructions: Fill 1/4 of a punch bowl with orange juice. Fill another 1/4 of the bowl with apple juice. Add 1/2 can of canned cherry juice, then add white rum to taste. Serve in cups.

name: Bend Me Over #2
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Strain into an old-fashioned glass or large shot glass, and shoot.

name: Berryessa Blast
instructions: Pour the gold rum and Southern Comfort into an old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice cubes. Add guava juice to taste, and serve.

name: Bin Laden #2
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a shot glass, and shoot.

name: Bird Bomb
instructions: Fill a hurricane glass half-way with ice. Add the Absolut vodka and DeKuyper Cheri-Beri Pucker. Fill with lemonade, and serve.

name: Black and Blue Buck
instructions: Pour the jagermeister over several ice cubes in a highball glass. Fill with Mountain Dew Pitch Black, and serve.

name: Black and White Cherry
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until the ice is crushed and the entire drink is creamy. Pour into a collins glass. Garnish with whipped cream and cherry, and serve.

name: Black Death
instructions: Stir the ingredients together in a whiskey sour glass, and drink through a straw.

name: Black Forest Cake
instructions: Layer ingredients in a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Black Gold #2
instructions: Combine equal amounts of Opal Nera black sambuca and Goldschlager in a shot glass, and serve.

name: Black Nazi
instructions: Mix the Jagermeister and Mountain Dew Pitch Black over ice in a highball glass and serve.

name: Bloody Monkey
instructions: Half-fill a highball glass with ice. Pour the grenadine around the inside of the glass and on top of the ice to give that bloody look to it. Next, add the vodka (more if you prefer), then the sour apple pucker. Add the ginger ale, and then fill with 7-up. Garnish as desired, and serve.

name: Blue Balalaika
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Blue Bucky
instructions: Pour all ingredients over crushed ice in a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Blue Downy
instructions: Pour the light rum, blue curacao, coconut milk and pineapple juice into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Shake or stir well. Garnish with a pineapple chunk and a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Blue Zero
instructions: Stir ingredients together with crushed ice in an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Blueberry Martini
instructions: Combine the Smirnoff blueberry vodka, triple sec and blueberry juice in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with Sprite, garnish with fresh blueberries, and serve.

name: Bourbon Supremo
instructions: Simply pour tonic water over bourbon whiskey and serve as is or with ice. A thirst quencher.

name: Bourbonime
instructions: Pour the bourbon whiskey into a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes. Add the juice of the lime and fill with coke. Garnish with a lime wedge and serve.

name: Brazilian Breeze
instructions: Pour the vanilla vodka and DeKuyper Sour Apple Pucker into a highball glass. Fill with orange juice, and serve.

name: Brown Eyed Pucker
instructions: Pour the DeKuyper Sour Apple Pucker into a tall glass. Add the Bacardi 151 rum, then add the Pepsi (alternatively, use Dr. Pepper). Stir and serve.

name: Bruce Doucet
instructions: The inventor of this drink liked to experiment with several other cocktails. Its origins are in northern Quebec, where a good fruity drink is always a treat. This drink is a personal favorite of several people.

name: Bubblegum Delight
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a highball glass, and serve.

name: Buffalo Chip
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a shot glass, and shoot.

name: Bust Your Black Nut
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a highball glass, and serve.

name: Butterbeer
instructions: Stir the butterscotch schnapps and cream soda together in a highball glass, and serve.

name: California Barbie
instructions: Pour the Malibu rum into a collins glass filled with ice cubes. Fill the glass with yellow lemonade. Stir and serve with a straw.

name: Canada Drink
instructions: Pour the Kirschwasser, Canadian whisky and lemon juice into a highball glass. Fill with ginger ale, garnish with a cherry, and serve.

name: Captain and Tonic
instructions: Pour the Captain Morgan spiced rum into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Fill with tonic water, stir, and serve.

name: Captain Jack Sparrow
instructions: Empty a 16 ounce bottle and add 6 ice cubes to it. Add the Bacardi 151 rum, Captain Morgan Original spiced rum, Southern Comfort and pineapple juice. Leave enough room at the top for the foam when you shake it up. Shake until ice cubes are pretty much melted and serve. May be served on ice if desired.

name: Captain on Acid
instructions: Mix all ingredients except grenadine and pour into a shot glass. Add grenadine and shoot. Shot should be blue on top and red on bottom.

name: Car Crash
instructions: Pour the Southern Comfort and amaretto almond liqueur into a collins glass over 1 or2 ice cubes. Fill the glass with 1/2 sweet and sour mix and 1/2 orange juice. Top with grenadine, and serve.

name: Caramel "J"
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender with ice and blend until smooth. Pour the mixture into a large cocktail glass and decorate with chocolate and caramel sauce swirls. Garnish with fresh fruit and a flower, and serve.

name: Caramel Apple
instructions: Pour the DeKuyper Sour Apple Pucker and Buttershots into a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes. Top with 7-up, and serve.

name: Caribbean Breeze #2
instructions: Stir ingredients over ice in a highball glass, and serve.

name: Caribbean Splash
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender with ice. Blend well and pour into two seperate wine glasses, and serve.

name: Carl
instructions: This is a very popular drink on the mountains (ie. Aspen, Colorado). If it is too strong, add salt and pepper to taste. It may be weird, but it is a great drink when you are up in the mountains on a cold winter night.

name: Caribbean Delight
instructions: Pour the Malibu coconut rum, vanilla schnapps and vodka into a highball glass. Add Sprite, and serve.

name: Catasmashed
instructions: A incredibly violent and potent mixture.

name: Cheaterita
instructions: Combine tequila, limeade and ice in a highball glass. Squeeze lime juice from the slice into mixture and then drop the rind in the glass as well. Stir and serve.

name: Cheef
instructions: Take a pint of freshly poured cold Carling and drink (neck) half of it in one. Pause for thought. Then with out stopping pour in the entire bottle of Reef and drink the remainder at your leisure. The Reef should be poured in one; any spillages should be noted and acted upon appropriately. The key to the whole cocktail is knowing when there is enough room in the pint glass to pour in the entire bottle of reef, refilling it to the brim without any spillage.

name: Cherry Bomb #5
instructions: Pour Red bull into a beer mug. Pour the cherry vodka seperately into a shot glass, drop into the beer mug, and chug.

name: Cherry Ice-Cream
instructions: Mix both the ice-cream and cherries together, and freeze in a mason jar or similar container.

name: Cherry Paradise
instructions: Pour the Malibu coconut rum and Everclear into a cup. Add Cherry Coke, and serve.

name: Cherry Popper #3
instructions: Pour Crown Royal Canadian whisky over ice (preferably 3-4 cubes), add Cherry Coca-Cola, stir lightly, and serve.

name: Cherry Spritzer
instructions: Pour the cherry juice into the old-fashioned glass filled previously with 3 to 5 ice cubes and add the mineral water. Stir before you serve. You can mix the juice and the mineral water in the fifty-fifty percent relation too, but it is faster energy-delivering and even healthier this way.

name: Chewbacca
instructions: Build as listed, garnish with orange, then scream like a wookie.

name: Chocolate Candy
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Stir, pour into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chocolate Covered Candy Cane
instructions: Pour the Godiva milk chocolate liqueur into a shot glass. Float the Rumple Minze on top. Tastes just like a chocolate covered candy cane.

name: Chocolate Fudge Shake
instructions: Combine the milk, ice cream and brownie in a blender and blend for at least 30 seconds. Let the froth settle before pouring into a tall glass. Add a mountain of whipped cream to the top and scatter the flaked chocolate onto the top.

name: Chocolate Pirate
instructions: Blend ingredients in a blender until smooth. Serve in a chilled wine goblet.

name: Chokorange
instructions: Combine both ingredients in a shot glass. Stir lightly, and serve.

name: Chuck Yeager
instructions: Chuck Yeager is pretty flexible; try other juice combinations (i.e. pineapple/banana or pineapple/strawberry, etc.). After a couple, you will launch into the atmosphere!

name: Citrus Rum Cooler
instructions: Add the spiced rum, Malibu coconut rum, orange juice, lemon juice, lime juice and sugar to a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a collins glass with ice. Fill with 7-up, and serve.

name: Cocky Carrot
instructions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and stir. Strain over ice into a collins glass. Garnish with an orange wheel, and serve.

name: Columbian Nose Bleed
instructions: The Columbian Nose Bleed was born in Columbia Missouri (home of the Tigers). Created by Jake Maulin, and loved by many. This is the perfect pre-game shot.

name: Cool Breeze
instructions: Pour the Stolichnaya (Stoli) vodka into a highball glass over 5 ice cubes. Fill with Lemon Perrier, and add the juice extracted from half a lemon. Stir and serve.

name: Cool Breeze Fru-Fru
instructions: Cool Breeze Fru-Fru is a variation of the Cool Breeze, a great vodka cocktail.

name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail #4
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail or martini shaker with ice and 2 squeezed lime wedges. Shake violently for 10 seconds. Strain into a martini or cocktail glass garnished with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Cranapple Martini
instructions: Add vodka and DeKuyper Sour Apple Pucker to an ice-filled cocktail or martini shaker. Splash enough cranberry juice to give red tint. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Crazy Moose
instructions: Pour Canadian Club whisky into shot glasses, and top with Maple Syrup. For added flavour, stir with a cinammon stick.

name: Crazy Ninja
instructions: Pour the Jim Beam Bourbon whiskey into a highball glass. Add the Sierra Mist and a couple of ice cubes, and serve.

name: Creamsicle #6
instructions: Place ice and vodka in a highball glass. Fill to top with orange soda, and serve.

name: Creamsicle #7
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker or blender with crushed ice, depending whether you want it chilled or not. May have to adjust orange juice and cream for taste, whether you like it tart or not. These are just approx. on juice and cream. Excellent drink for the person who likes creamy drinks.

name: D.W.I.
instructions: Combine all three ingredients in a large pint glass, stir quickly and chug.

name: Dark and Veiny
instructions: Layer in order; butterscotch first, irish cream, jagermeister, vodka into a shot glass, and serve.

name: Davey Crockett
instructions: Mix the blue curacao, peach schnapps and orange juice together in a mixing glass. Pour over crushed ice in an old-fashioned glass or large cocktail glass, and serve.

name: De-Lay
instructions: This drink is named De-Lay, notably because it goes down smooth, then it implodes.

name: Detroit Fermi
instructions: Combine all ingredients in an old-fashioned or lowball glass; ignite, extinguish and serve.

name: Dib Dab
instructions: Fill a hurricane glass with ice add all ingredients. Shake or stir vigorously. Top with lemonade, to taste, and serve.

name: Didaccino
instructions: A chocolate and coffee-flavored digestif invented in the DIDA bar in Paris, France.

name: Dirty Grandmother
instructions: Pour Newfoundland Screech dark rum and Kahlua coffee liqueur over ice in a cocktail glass. Fill with milk or light cream, stir and serve.

name: Double Bubble
instructions: Mix the firewater and pina colada mix in a shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and serve.

name: Double Fudge Martini #2
instructions: Shake the Absolut vodka, Kahlua coffee liqueur, espresso coffee and chocolate topping with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. In a fresh shaker, shake cream and DeKuyper Buttershots (butterscotch liqueur) until thickened and float on top of the chocolate mix. Garnish with grated chocolate and chocoloate topping, and serve.

name: Douchebag
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a glass and serve.

name: Dr. Jager
instructions: Pour ingredients in equal parts into a cocktail glass; stir and serve.

name: Dr. Pepper #6
instructions: Place a 1-oz shot glass filled with amaretto almond liqueur into an old-fashioned glass. Place beer around the shot; fill with cola, and chug.

name: Dreamsicle Jello Shots
instructions: Mix hot water and jello. Add liqueur. Pour into 2 ounce glasses or cups. Serve after the jello has set.

name: El Swavo
instructions: El Swavo is one of the newer drinks in the Chicago area bars. Most popular with the college kids.

name: El Torro Loco
instructions: Add crushed ice, gin, vodka, and red bull to a cocktail shaker, or use two glasses to mix. Pour into a collins glass over ice, add a splash of grenadine and garnish with cherries.

name: Elderflower Martini
instructions: Elderflower is a traditional flavour of Scandinavian summer.

name: Emily Emily
instructions: Muddle the kumquats in the bottom of a mixing glass. Add the other ingredients and shake vigorously. Double strain into a collins glass, and serve.

name: Evershock
instructions: Stir ingredients together in equal parts in a shot glass, and shoot.

name: Fashion Victim
instructions: Shake all but the Sprite in a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour over a glass half-filled with ice cubes. Add the Sprite to taste, and a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Fiery Hot Anus
instructions: Pour the Bacardi 151 rum into a freshly opened bottle of Corona lager. Fill to the brim with Tabasco sauce. Serve cold, lime optional.

name: Fire in the Hole
instructions: Pour habenero sauce into a shot glass; add everclear. Dash cayenne pepper on top and serve.

name: Flaming Hot Chocolate
instructions: Fill a shot glass three-quarters full with creme de cacao. Top with Bacardi 151 rum and ignite. Allow to burn for 10- 20 seconds, extinguish and serve.

name: Flaming Liquid Cocaine Blaster
instructions: This great flaming bomb recipe; named Flaming Liquid Cocaine Blaster was first discovered at McGees bar in Nevada City, California along with the the drink True Red Devil.

name: Foamy Irishman
instructions: Combine all ingredients with 5 - 10 ice cubes in a blender. Blend until the ice is melted or close to it. The ice will melt soon anyway but leave the drink nice and cold. By the time the ice melts during blending it should have some nice head on it. (Hence the foamy.) Serve in glass of choice and enjoy.

name: Freak Show
instructions: Pour the sambuca into the bottle of a beer mug. Slowly add the Guinness to float it on top. Serve.

name: Frozen Dreamsicle
instructions: Combine all ingredients together in a blender. Blend until smooth and pour into a tall glass. Top with whipped cream, and serve.

name: Fucked Up Greek
instructions: Fucked Up Greek was made by Jesse Peters. The recipe originated in Winnipeg Canada and is quite popular with the ladies!

name: Gay Mountie
instructions: Pour the Canadian whisky over ice into an old-fashioned glass. Add the sweet vermouth, amaretto and Yukon Jack. Top with a cherry, stir and serve.

name: German Mouthwash
instructions: Pour both ingredients in equal parts into a shot glass, stir and serve.

name: Ginemade
instructions: Add the gin to the lemonade in a pitcher. Serve into glasses or cups.

name: Ginger Float
instructions: Pour the amaretto almond liqueur and irish cream into a highball glass 3/4 filled with ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, to taste, stir briskly and serve.

name: Giraffe snot
instructions: Combine all ingredients (except passion-fruit) in a blender. Blend well and stop. Add passion-fruit, blend again quickly in order to keep seeds intact. Pour into cocktail glasses, and serve.

name: Go-Go Girl
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add rum and mango nectar. Top off glass with pineapple juice. Stir. Garnish with a slice of pineapple, and serve.

name: Gold Wizard
instructions: Shake the Chardonnay, the banana liqueur and the vodka together in a cocktail shaker with 2 ice cubes for 30 seconds. Pour into a cocktail glass with a cherry at the bottom, and serve.

name: Golden Martini
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Shake well, strain into cocktail glasses, and serve.

name: Golden Salsa
instructions: Combine both ingredients over crushed ice in a collins glass, and serve.

name: Goombay Smash #3
instructions: Pour the Bacardi gold rum and Bacardi Coco rum, along with the pineapple juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake untill well chilled. Strain into a highball glass filled with ice cubes, and add a splash of sweet and sour mix. Stir lightly and serve.

name: Green Apple and Butter Jello Shots
instructions: Dissolve the jello in the boiling water. Add the DeKuyper Buttershots and stir. Pour into small cups and refrigerate.

name: Green Goblin Cocktail
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well and pour over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Serve with a lime wedge.

name: Green Hornet Shot
instructions: Layer the McGuinness melon liqueur and Phillips butterscotch schnapps in a shot glass. Add a splash of ginger ale, and serve.

name: Green Lizard
instructions: Combine either Wild Turkey 151 or Bacardi 151 proof rum with the green chartreuse in an old-fashioned rocks glass or serve up in a cocktail glass.

name: Green Mamba
instructions: A popular drink in south eastern New York.

name: Guillotine Shot
instructions: Mix the benedictine, gin and lemon juice together in a mixing glass. Sweeten to taste. Pour into shot glass(es), and serve.

name: Hair Dryer
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a margarita glass, and serve.

name: Hawaiian Barbie
instructions: Pour the Malibu coconut rum into a collins glass filled with ice cubes. Add the Dole pineapple juice and tonic water, and stir. Place a chunk of pineapple on the top, and serve with a straw.

name: Hawaiian Surfer on Acid
instructions: A refreshing drink, not too sweet.

name: Bacardi Hawaiian Punch
instructions: Pour the Bacardi flavored rums into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Add the cranberry juice and pineapple juice and shake well. Strain into a hurricane glass filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Heaven and Hell
instructions: Shake ingredients together in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Strain into a shot glass, and serve.

name: Hell No
instructions: Pour and stir each ingredient into a mixing glass with ice, stirring continuously. Strain into shot glasses, and serve.

name: Hematoma
instructions: The name Hematoma derives from how the blue curacao drizzles down the drink and creates a heavy bruised black and blue look. Credit goes to Lauren Simpkins, Corpus Christi, TX.

name: Hole in the Head
instructions: Fill half of a shot glass with Sambuca. Slowly fill the other half with vodka (to get layer effect). Add 3 drops of Tabasco sauce (it should swim in between the two layers) and serve.

name: Honey Bunny
instructions: Build all three ingredients over ice in a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Horny Kermit
instructions: A man named Mitch Power created this recipe in Australia working as a Barman at an army barracks, using the left over liqueurs. The Horny Kermit went down a treat with the recruits and is now a best seller.

name: Hot Carl
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Hot Minty Kiss
instructions: Add the Irish whiskey to the hot coffee first. Follow by adding the creme de menthe and creme de cacao, and serve.

name: Hot Shot #3
instructions: Layer the Frangelico hazelut liqueur, coffee and whipped cream on top of one another (Frangelico on the bottom) in an 8-oz highball glass or equivalent. Sprinkle the crushed hazlenuts on top, and serve.

name: Hot Southern Night
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes. Add firewater and Southern Comfort, fill with cola and serve.

name: Hpno Chronic
instructions: Layer ingredients in a shot glass, and serve.

name: Hpno Tonic
instructions: Layer ingredients in a shot glass, and serve.

name: Hpnotiq Breeze #2
instructions: Combine all ingrdients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Hpnotiq Margarita
instructions: Pour the Hpnotiq, triple sec, Jose Cuervo gold tequila and lime juice into a collins glass filled with ice cubes. Fill to the top with sweet and sour mix, and serve.

name: Hurricane Sunrise
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a hurricane glass with ice as desired, and mix well. Garnish with maraschino cherries and orange slices (optional), and serve.

name: Hypnotic Martini
instructions: Combine all ingredients over ice in a cocktail shaker and shake well. Strain into a martini or cocktail glass and serve.

name: Hypnotiq Slice
instructions: The Hypnotiq Slice shot originated in Guam. It is popular at the famous clubs 10-21 and DJ Bar Club Kamikazee.

name: Ice Breaker #3
instructions: Pour the Pernod and creme de menthe into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Add the lime juice and fill with lemonade; stir. Garnish with a sprig of mint (optional), and serve.

name: Ice Shot
instructions: Chill the ingredients, then mix in a highball glass and sprinkle some ground cinnamon on top if desired.

name: Iced Tea and Malibu
instructions: Iced Tea and Malibu is a very popular drink combination on the patios in Calgary Alberta, Canada.

name: Iced Fritter
instructions: Stir the Tia Maria coffee liqueur and chocolate milk together with 3 ice cubes in a highball or other tall glass. Serve.

name: IED (Improvised Explosive Device)
instructions: This recipe was created by 2nd Platoon, Military Police Company C, United States Marine Corps (Reserve), quote "After 2 combat tours in Iraq over the past 2 years, we decided to honor those of us injured and to toast our fellow Marines killed by IEDs in Iraq. We just developed it in the barracks and will be taking it public the night of the Marine Corps Birthday Ball, November 10th [2004]."

name: Ikonoclast
instructions: Pour the Ikon vodka and creme de cacao into a cocktail or martini shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and pour into a chilled cocktail or martini glass. Top with three swirls of whipped cream and a cranberry rolled in sugar, and serve.

name: Goombay Smash Bahamas
instructions: This Bahamas version of the Goombay Smash was discovered on the Abaco Islands on Elbow Cay, several years ago. Tastes best when listening to Jimmy Buffett or similar island music.

name: Irish Pancake
instructions: The Irish Pancake is popular in Middle TN among those who have a taste for an already fine beer. It tastes like a stack of buttery pancakes. Quite enjoyable.

name: Irish Shake
instructions: Blend all the ingredients except the whipped cream in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Pour into a frappe glass (or similar), cover it with the whipped cream, and serve.

name: Island Doctor
instructions: The Island Doctor was created at a Pirate party in Atlanta GA, May 2004.

name: Italian Greyhound
instructions: An extension on the Greyhound drink, popular in summer. Credit to Andrew Hildebrand, a bartender at the W hotel, San Diego.

name: Itchy Ass
instructions: Pour the shot of Blackhouse blackberry schnapps into a collins glass half-filled with ice cubes. Add the Zima. Serve unstirred.

name: Beach Bum Shake
instructions: Pour the tequila, orange juice, vodka and triple sec into a cocktail shaker with crushed ice and shake for about a minute. Strain into hurricane glass. Add a tiny umbrella and slice of lemon (optional), and serve.

name: Bitch Slammer
instructions: The Bitch Slammer was invented in Russia by Toni Pinto and Fernando Peeman. In recent years the drink has increased its popularity among Yuppies in central and northern Europe, and is now a staple of the consulting, insurance and mobile industry subcultures.

name: Blue Dragonfly
instructions: Combine the Hpnotiq liqueur and Absolut Vanilla vodka over ice in a chilled cocktail glass. Top with Sprite and serve.

name: Cherry MacGregor
instructions: Take down the shot of Clan Macgregor Scotch whisky; chase with shot of cherry coke.

name: Jackalope Punch
instructions: Jackalope Punch is adapted from another drink in order to make use of lovable Dole Pineapple Passion Mango juice. The drink has a nice kick even though it tastes pretty mild.

name: Jackass
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a red wine glass; swirl until mixed. Add several ice cubes and serve.

name: Jager Drop
instructions: Jager Drop is a variant of the Jager Bomb; the addition is that of the Monster energy drink.

name: Jagerade
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a collins glass half-filled with ice cubes; stir and serve.

name: Holiday Captain Pepsi
instructions: Pour the Captain Morgan spiced rum into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Fill with Holiday Spice Pepsi cola, and serve.

name: Jamaican Tease
instructions: Pour the DeKuyper Buttershots butterscotch schnapps and Malibu rum into a highball glass. Fill with chilled orange juice, and serve.

name: Jaygo
instructions: Jaygo should taste like strawberry licorice when mixed correctly...

name: Jello Love
instructions: Pour the Bacardi O, DeKuyper Watermelon Pucker schnapps and Cruzan orange rum into a cup and mix well. Add the Gatorade Fierce Melon; do not stir. Chill for one hour before serving.

name: Jelly Donut
instructions: Pour the Tropicana kiwi-strawberry juice, the Bacardi white rum, and the DeKuyper razzmatazz liqueur into a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes. Float about 1/2 inch of half-and-half onto the mixture; done by slowly pouring the cream over the back of a spoon so that the cream stays separate from the rest of the drink. Serve.

name: Jim Cox
instructions: Stir ingredients together in an old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: JMO Sling
instructions: This variation on the Singapore Sling is popular in Ohio and central Pennsylvania.

name: Jo Jo Superspy
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake briskly. Pour into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Johnny Bravo
instructions: Pour the Absolut vodka, peach schnapps, DeKuyper Watermelon Pucker schnapps and blue curacao into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Add the cranberry juice, and serve.

name: Jagermilch
instructions: A very smooth tasting shot drink, otherwise known as Hunter-milk.

name: K-Snap
instructions: Stir both ingredients together in a cocktail glass with/without shaven ice, as desired, and serve.

name: K-Town Cherry Cola
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Cover and shake; serve immediately.

name: Kalashnikov Shot
instructions: Almost fill a shot glass with vodka, then place a lemon slice across the top of the glass so that it covers half of the diameter. Fill the rest of the shot glass with absinthe, pouring so that is passes through the slice of lemon. Add sugar and cinnamon (cinnamon is optional) to the lemon and finally, ignite it. When the flame extinguishes itself, take the shot and eat the lemon.

name: Blond Headed Slut
instructions: Chill and serve.

name: Blue Trane
instructions: The drink Blue Trane is named after legendary jazz musician John Coltrane.

name: Evening in Paris
instructions: Pour the pineapple juice, orange juice, lemon juice, peach vodka and sugar into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well for 30 seconds. Pour unstrained into a large glass (hurricane or otherwise) and add 7-UP. Stir briefly and serve.

name: Firefly
instructions: Fill a highball glass with cubed ice. Stir in vodka and grapefruit juice. Add the grenadine after stirring, and place it in the center of the drink.

name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail #5
instructions: Combine the Smirnoff vodka, triple sec, fresh lime juice and cranberry juice in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a frosted cocktail glass. Rub the rim with orange zest (if desired) and drop it into the glass. Serve.

name: Kato
instructions: Pour the tea into a hurricane glass over ice. Add the Malibu mango rum, stir and serve.

name: Espresso-tini
instructions: Add ingredients to a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake it up and serve in frozen martini or cocktail glasses. Line the rim with cinnamon and cocoa. Throw in a coffee bean for good luck, and serve.

name: Kerry-Jo
instructions: The Kerry-Jo drink is similar to a Kir Royale, only better!

name: Key Lime Pie #2
instructions: Combine ingredients with ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake, strain into shot glasses, and serve.

name: Killer Kool-Aid (Canada)
instructions: Pour the Stoli Razberi vodka, melon liqueur and 7-UP into a chilled cocktail glass over a small amount of ice. Top it off with cranberry juice, more if desired, and serve.

name: King Burro
instructions: Combine the coffee liqueur, light rum, coconut cream, milk and banana in a blender with half a cup of crushed ice. Blend until smooth. Pour into a hurricane glass, garnish with a slice of banana and serve.

name: Strawberry-Peach Daiquiri
instructions: Add strawberries, Bacardi white rum, DeKuyper Peachtree schnapps, sugar, and lemon juice to a blender with one cup of crushed ice (more or less if desired). Blend until icy with no chunks of ice remaining. Pour into a hurricane glass, garnish with a slice or two of strawberry, and serve.

name: Kula-for-Shula
instructions: Combine the Bacardi 151 rum, vodka, and Gatorade Citrus Cooler together over ice in a collins glass, and stir. Finish with a splash of amaretto almond liqueur, and serve.

name: Lakeside Lemonade
instructions: Pour the Absolut Citron and triple sec into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Almost fill with sweet and sour mix, and add a splash of lemon-lime soda and splash of cranberry juice. Garnish with a slice of lemon, and serve.

name: Laser Beam Shot
instructions: Chill the ingredients beforehand. Layer ingredients, in order, into a shot glass; Midori at the bottom (or other melon schnapps), Goldschlager, Jagermeister at the top.

name: GordBuster from Hell
instructions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, pour into an old-fashioned or highball glass, and serve.

name: Tequila Seabreeze
instructions: Pour the tequila into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Add the cranberry juice and grapefruit juice. Stir, garnish with a lime wedge, and serve.!

name: Leftover Salmon
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl; ice if desired. Stir well.

name: Lemon Drop Martini
instructions: Place the sugar and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker. Swirl the shaker around so that both ingredients are mixed thoroughly. Add ice cubes. Add the vodka, triple sec and margarita mix, and shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Add rimmers to make the drink look nice, if you have them.

name: Lime Avenger
instructions: Pour the lime vodka into a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes. Add the Mountain Dew, and serve.

name: Limetini
instructions: Pour the vodka, triple sec and lime juice into a cocktail shaker with a couple of ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a martini or cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Limon Spritzer
instructions: Pour the Bacardi Limon into a collins glass. Fill with the can of Sprite. Add a piece of lemon, and serve.

name: Limon Squeeze
instructions: The Limon Squeeze, contributed by Karen Barteld, is a great refreshing lemon-flavored drink for the hot summer weather.

name: Liquid Watermelon
instructions: Pour grenadine into a margarita or cocktail glass. Place some ice cubes in a cocktail shaker, and add the vodka, watermelon schnapps, Midori melon liqueur and sour mix to the shaker. Shake well, pour into the margarita / cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Listerine Shot
instructions: This shot drink takes its name from the inherent color of the mixture; resembling that of Listerine Mouthwash.

name: Little Leprechaun
instructions: Pour the Irish whiskey into a shot glass. Add the Goldschlager cinnamon schnapps, then the creme de menthe, and serve.

name: Longdog
instructions: Invented by Steve "Longdog" Kemmo on a late night session in Milan, May 2004. A merge of a Long Island and a Bulldog, Longdog is a surprisingly refreshing drink that hits the spot.

name: Love Hotel
instructions: Pour the sake and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a highball glass. Add the grenadine. Stir very lightly, and serve.

name: Bottom Bouncer
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Strain into a highball glass, and serve.

name: Lunatic Giant
instructions: Lunatic Giant is a traditional drink originating from Kontula, Finland. A very special mixture of the finest ingredients creates a wonderful taste of the afterlife.

name: Lunchbox
instructions: First, pour the orange juice into a highball glass. Add the beer. Take a shot glass, pour the amaretto in, then southern comfort. Drop the shot glass into the highball glass, then chug.

name: Luscious Leslie
instructions: Pour equal shots of Malibu coconut rum, Southern Comfort, amaretto almond liqueur and Captain Morgan spiced rum into a highball glass. Fill the remainder of the glass with pineapple juice, and add just a splash of grenadine. Shake well to mix all ingredients, and serve.

name: Luscious Lou
instructions: Luscious Lou was made by Lou Rudy, general manager and bartender at Cafe Topsy and Dublin 6 in New York City (NYC), USA.

name: Lychee Martini
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with/without ice. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: 352 Cocktail
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a shot glass, and shoot.

name: Beer Margarita
instructions: In a large pitcher mix the Corona and limeade mixture (follow the directions on the frozen limeade except substitute one can of water with one can of vodka - cheap is fine). Serve in frosted mugs with ice.

name: Blonde Headed Slut
instructions: Shake the Grand Marnier, peach schnapps and pineapple juice in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Strain into a shot glass, and shoot.

name: Spiced Lemon
instructions: Pour the Country Time lemonade into a highball glass. Add the spiced vodka, stir and serve.

name: Crystal Telekenisis
instructions: Pour the Mountain Dew Baja Blast into a cocktail glass. Add peach schnapps (or Hpnotiq liqueur), stir briefly and serve.

name: Green Spade
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a cup or highball glass, and serve.

name: Hidden Grapefruit
instructions: Shake well with ice and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of orange, and serve.

name: Mad Dog Shot
instructions: Pour the vodka into a shot glass and add some raspberry syrup (should be concentrated, look for it at a Polish section in an international supermarket). Add a few drops of Tabasco hot sauce., and shoot.

name: Malibu Barbie #2
instructions: Pour the Malibu rum into a collins glass filled with ice cubes. Fill the rest of the glass with pink lemonade, stir and serve with a straw.

name: Malibu Breeze
instructions: Pour the Malibu coconut rum into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Add the grenadine and top with pineapple juice. Stir and serve.

name: Malibu Paradise
instructions: Pour the Malibu coconut rum, Absolut vodka, cranberry and pineapple juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, pour into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Malibu Reggae Rainbow
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes. Pour in the Malibu rum, then Midori melon liqueur (which will sink to the bottom). Gently pour in pineapple juice. Do not shake. Gently splash in a bit of cranberry juice. Do not mix. Drink will be layered, from top to bottom; green, yellow, red.

name: Manilla Gorilla
instructions: Combine the vanilla vodka, banana liqueur and cream in a cocktail shaker with crushed ice. Shake gently. Serve in highball or shot glasses.

name: Martha Stewart
instructions: Pour the Bacardi 151 rum and Wild Turkey 101 bourbon whiskey into a shot glass. Stir, and float grenadine on top. Shoot immediately.

name: Martini Clementine
instructions: The Martini Clementine is named after Clementine tangerines because the taste is so reminiscent.

name: Martini Dominikanis
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon, and serve.

name: Marvin The Martian
instructions: Pour the cherry-flavored brandy into a collins glass half-filled with ice. Add the Mountain Dew, and serve.

name: Maui Cocktail
instructions: Add the Mountain Dew Code Red to a highball glass over ice, then add in the rum, and serve.

name: Medusa Punch
instructions: Fill a container (size of an iced-tea pitcher) almost halfway with ice. Fill to slightly above ice with a decent California White Zinfandel. Add one part peach schnapps, and a splash of sour mix. Fill the remaining space (should be a little less than a quarter of the pitcher) with cranberry juice. Seal and shake vigourously. Serve in glasses.

name: Melon Breeze
instructions: Fill a collins glass with ice. Pour in the Malibu coconut rum. Fill with pineapple juice, top with Midori melon liqueur, and serve.

name: Menace Shot
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a 2-oz shot glass, and shoot.

name: Menstrual Cycle
instructions: Pour the sour lemonade into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Add the sloe gin (see how pretty they "bleed together") then add the vodka. Stir and serve.

name: Merry Christmas
instructions: Pour all ingredients (chilled beforehand) into a large container or punch bowl, preferably on top of another similar container filled with ice. Allow to chill. Serve in punch cups or tall glasses.

name: Irish Cream #4
instructions: Add condensed milk, evaporated milk, Scotch whiskey, vanilla essence and glycerine to a saucepan. Stir well. Dissolve coffee in boiling water. Mix in. Chill. Add cream if desired.

name: Balalika
instructions: Add ingredients to a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes, and shake well. Strain into a martini or cocktail glass, add a slice of lime peel and serve.

name: Blue Flush
instructions: Pour the Crown Royal Canadian Whisky, peach schnapps, blue curacao and cranberry juice all into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into shot glasses or a single large shot glass, and serve.

name: Bronze Monkey
instructions: Shake ingredients together in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Pour into a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Broo-ha-ha
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a shot glass, stir and serve.

name: Brown-eye
instructions: Use any appropriate glass filled with ice cubes, and mix 3 parts of your vodka of choice (preferably not cheap vodka, use Finlandia, Absolut or Grey Goose), with 1 part Coke, or follow the amounts above in a highball or old-fashioned glass.

name: Bubble Comfort
instructions: Pour the Southern Comfort into a highball glass; add the orange soda and the root beer. Stir lightly. Add more Southern Comfort for strength if desired, and serve.

name: Burning Sunset
